We joke and say it helps to make the room look bigger. We open the curtains and â€œour city viewâ€� is the old Grayhound Bus terminal. I tried to turn on the light next to the bed but it was burned out. My girlfriend goes into the bathroom and the toilet wouldnâ€™t flush properly. One had to hold it down until the cycle was completely done. The kicker was the size of the bathroom. The bathroom was so small that there was no bathtub, the shower length was only about 5 feet and they couldnâ€™t install a door on the shower as there wouldnâ€™t be enough room to open outwards. Instead they had a half glass wall on the left-hand side. The problem with this design was that the shower knobs were on the right side and the shower head was on the left, so when one turns on the water, the stream would hit you in the face and body if you wanted to warm up the shower while you were getting undressed. In addition, with only a half glass wall on the left-hand side, the showerhead would shoot the water out onto the floor of the bathroom and would pour into our hallway. Would never stay there again and obviously, I am taking the time to write this lengthy review to warn others about the Sophia Hotel. I see on various travel sites that the Sophia Hotel just got downgraded to 3 stars, which is much too generous in my opinion. .

Reviews.Title: “Petite”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: Petite is the word we used to describe this hotel. As others have said, the rooms are TINY. The bathroom is TINY. I get it as this is an old building. But, WOW.............small rooms! They are updated and very clean and decorated nicely. The shower was small, but had unlimited hot water and great pressue. There is not a door on the shower so water gets all over the floor - I was not a fan of this. The TV is also TINY. I guess everything at the hotel is TINY. LOL. Parking is a challenge and I got lucky with a spot on the street across from the hotel. The location is excellent - right at Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp. Walking distance to bars/restaurants, etc. The lobby is lacking... not that having a lobby would make or break my feelings on a hotel. But, it just didn't have any pizazz. It was..... blah. Again, not a very important item, but just something I noticed. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to somone if they found a great deal. But, it would not be my first choice when staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice!”
Reviews.Author: sanglin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Sat night for my work party.... walking distance to resturants and down town. Coffee Bean right next door awesome! Pricey hotel for how little it was and the rooms were extremely small! The bathroom was clean but water goes all over the floor no door?! Bed very cozy, like I small but nice. I don't like the policy the hotel has of holding you money, I had to pay 100 a night and they held 200...don't like that at all! Had fresh water w/ lemons @ the front desk that was super nice. Decorating very nicely. The resturant inside hotel looked really nice, but got back to hotel @ about 11pm and bar was closed...so that stunk. One thing I have to say is the car bell hops were out of this world awesommme! You need anything form your car they run and I mean run and get it for you. I don't like the extra 30 dollar parking fee per night but it is to be expected in down town San Diego where there is no parking.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quiet, clean”
Reviews.Author: HappilyHopeful
Reviews.Content: Great location, takes about 15 minutes from airport for under $3.00 using public transportation. Rooms are very nice, clean, the work out facility was well equipped with modern equipment and a yoga studio. The staff was knowledgeable and made excellent recommendations. Comfy and quiet and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: the_farmers_wife54
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6-night stay at The Sofia Hotel and it was fantastic--an all-around good experience. I went to San Diego to conduct research for graduate school and usually by the end of the week I'm ready to go home. But i had such a wonderful experience at the Sofia that the week breezed by. Reasons why I enjoyed it so much: 1) The staff: The first night I checked in, the front desk staff asked me what brought me to town and how they could be of assistance during my stay. The days following as I passed by the front desk I was greeted by name and asked how my research was going, how my stay was, etc. They provided me with maps of the area, restaurant recommendations, scenic routes for my morning runs, and directions. They were extremely attentive. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job. No complaints there. 2) The room: Yes, they are small but this is a boutique hotel--not a Sheraton or Marriott. But, for a solo traveler (and even if I traveled with my spouse) the room was big enough for what I needed. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The bed: one of the most comfortable I've slept in--soft sheets, extra pillows, duvet. Bathroom: rainhead shower, large, soft towels, above-counter sink (spa-like atmosphere), lighted make-up mirror (Huge plus!). Wireless connection (daily fee), desk, comfy chair, bottles of water, fridge and microwave. Everything I needed. 3) Restaurant: Currant Brasserie is connected to The Sofia and I ate there three out of six nights (better food and deal than the restaurants around the gaslamp quarter). Their happy hour specials are a very good deal (1/2 price burgers, appetizers, etc) and I met a number of locals who eat there for their delicious food. Great wait staff. 4) Location: One block from great shopping at Horton Plaza, Gaslamp Quarter, minutes from the water, coffee shop right outside the hotel. I felt very safe walking around at night by myself. 5) Fitness Center: May not be a big deal to some, but I work out every day and their fitness center was very nice: medicine balls, bosu, weight machines, treadmills with TVs, and a separate yoga studio. There were dvds, mats, and all the yoga equipment in the studio to have your own yoga session. But running alongside the water in the morning is quite beautiful... If I ever need to go back to San Diego, i will definitely stay at The Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Still good”
Reviews.Author: travelgal75
Reviews.Content: I visited (and reviewed) this hotel in Nov 2007. I was pleased enough with the hotel the first time that I returned again in Aug 2010. (This time I was placed in a larger room...) The room was comfortable and clean. Despite being on the corner, I didn't find the street noise to be bothersome or even very noticeable at night. As others have written, I was also pleased to have the coffee maker in the room. The staff are as helpful as you would expect them to be. The location is convenient for visiting the Gaslamp Quarter, the Convention Center, and the Wharf (if you don't mind walking a little). The train station is also within walking distance. Walking around the neighborhood of the hotel was safe enough (at reasonable hours of the day/night). I recommend the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast/lunch, but it's not cheap. One downside was a lack of internet service in the rooms, though there is free wifi in the lobby and 3 computers for visitors to use as well. All in all a very nice stay. I hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_beach_911
Reviews.Content: The rooms at The Sofia are really classy and they definitely make the most out of the space. I liked the above-counter sinks. Close to everything downtown which is great. Valet parking is your only option and a little pricey...but its worth it when you factor in how hard it is to find parking downtown. Would definitely stay again and would like to try their restaurant next time!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great gaslamp location”
Reviews.Author: roeboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia for 6 nights in September 2010 as part of our San Diego vacation. The hotel itself is very modern and hipster in feel and ambiance. The lobby and ajoining restaurant are quite plush and inviting. The location is great. In San Diego, when choosing to stay downtown then assuming you want some nightlife and a bit of a scene then you really should stay near or within the Gaslamp Quarter. This is basically a 16 block radius of restaurants, bars, shops and nightclubs. The Sofia is just on the fringes of it and thus offers the best of both worlds: close enough to walk to and from your night out but just far enough away that the noise from the local establishments won't keep you up until the wee hours if you have planned on having an early night. In terms of location, the Sofia is in a better location than the similarly priced Gaslamp Plaza Suites which I stayed at in 2009 and have previously posted a review for. Some people have commented on the Sofia's proximity to the Greyhound Bus Depo and the problems this causes in relation to the close proximity to the many homeless in SD... I encountered no problems with this and both my wife and I felt perfectly safe walking about at night... Sure you will have some encounters but to be honest the homeless problem in downtown SD is so noticable that you would have issues with it regardless of where you stayed. The front desk and concierge were very helpful. As an example, they allowed us to borrow 2 bikes free of charge to take and cycle arounfdCoronado Island for the day. The gym and Yoga studio wereideal and allowed us both to get our morning workouts in before breakfast. Special mention for the lemon infused water that was freely available throughout the hotel and in the gym, seriously refreshing. The only downside, and its kinda a big one, was the acual size of the room. It was painfully small and by the end of the 6 nights it was becoming more and more of an issue. Don't get me wrong, they have made a great use of the space afforded to each room but that does not deflect from the fact that, even just with the 2 of us... it was cramped. In this regard, the aforementioned Gaslamp Plaza Suites rooms were far more appealing. All in all though, the Sofia is a modern, funky boutique hotel in a great location and SD itself, both downtown and out to the beach towns of Coronado and PB is a magificent place to go your holidays

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrmets
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this unique boutique hotel. It is an Historic Landmark having been built almost 100 years ago. It once housed the original radio/TV station for Art Linkletter and launched his career. Nice little hotel that was nicely decorated for the holidays. Rooms are a bit small and the bathroom a bit tight. Can be a bit noisy if you have a room on a lower floor so ask to be on the 5th floor or higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and After Service”
Reviews.Author: Kees56
Reviews.Content: Visited my daughter in San Diego with a friend. Got a great suite. Comfortable beds, very clean and nice looking rooms. Got great service from everybody, including the valet parking. Forgot my shoes and called after a week. Perfect service there too!

Reviews.Title: “Great pick for its worth.”
Reviews.Author: koolbargan
Reviews.Content: This trip was primarily for my husband's conference and leisure for me so our location choice had to be within the conference venue. LOCATION : (Rating : EXCELLENT) Prior to our finally selecting this hotel, I had some misgivings about the "homeless" and security of both the area and this hotel from reading reviews and am glad we went with our gut feel and booked it anyway. It's definitely downtown making it very convenient to catch the local bus, train and trolley to most of the sights. About a block away is the Horton Plaza, which, if you went to San Diego to shop would be good (not us) , restaurant outlets and other shops. The most convenience to us, however, was the Ralph's Supermarket across Horton Plaza (or about 2-3 blocks from the Sofia). There was a 7-Eleven nearer the hotel but the price and selection was far better at Ralph's. There was a review that mentioned security of this area because of jail/bondsmen offices in the area but frankly, it was never an issue with me, considering I was mostly by myself for 3 days while my husband was attending a conference. As common sense dictates, awareness and care ought to be taken anywhere and everywhere. ACCOMMODATIONS : (Rating : ABOVE AVERAGE) For it's class and it's historic background, the Sofia is well beyond it's worth. Granted that the room is indeed cozy (small-ish) that having both my husband and I walking past each other by the bed and the entertainment center was a squeeze, still it packed in everything else we could ever ask for... a microwave, and refrigerator, which is not normally available in most hotel rooms but which definitely made our stay more worthwhile. And a "MUST" to our hotel choice always....a coffeemaker, which in the Sofia, is a definite perk with the Cuisineart coffee, which I have to admit was a first taste for me and I found them almost as good as Starbucks. The water pressure was never a problem. The only 2 negatives (which would have made my accommodation rating excellent) was one, the shower configuration. The glass enlosure was only half the shower stall that water was everywhere after a shower. Second, would be lack of soap dish by the counnter/wash area . The above-the-counter glass bowl/basin was aesthetically pleasing and trendy but once used, the handsoap just had no place to stay as it just kept sliiping into the bowl. On our first 3 days, we used a plastic bag to lay the handsoap on so as not to ruin the beautiful counter. Thankfully, on our 4th day, there was a Sofia coaster provided for by the cleaning lady that day. Of course, it was totally soaked before the night was over . Very simple remedy that I am sure the Sofia will look into and provide for for future guests. The linens and pillows were very comfortable . Our room was on the 4th floor, facing the Courthouse. Noise was not a problem, the A/C was simply divine as it was the 80s and 90s in the days we were there. The ice-machine was also in the 4th floor, another big convenience! Other-in-room amenities: Iron / ironing board Radio / Ipod dock (the added feature of the "white noise" option was great) Hairdryer Toiletries was excellent (soaps, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and mouthwash) AMENITIES: (Rating: EXCELLENT for it's class) For clarification, my rating is based on those we have experienced and therefore, would not speak for The Currant", the hotel's retaurant as we unfortunately, did not have the privilege of dining there. However, based on how it looked and how it was really packed most lunches and evenings we were there, it probably is notable, too. The other hotel amenities worth mentioning are the Ice-machines on designated floors, the business center, which was conveneiently located in the lobby, the bikes and helmets offered FREE for hotel guests from dusk and the walking tour on Sundays. SERVICE : (Rating : EXCELLENT) Special kudos to the Front Desk staff (check-in date was 10/30). As guests not only in the hotel but to city as well, it was quite refreshing to find hotel staff very amiable and not just work-driven to help out guests like us for directions and information. I would also like to make special mention of the housekeeping staff. SImply superb! A minor note, there was indeed an additional daily fee of about $ 2.97 (or thereabouts) for historical preserevation cost upon our check-out . Though, this was not really a problem nor was the cost, it indeed would be better if it is understood clearly on their website or added to costs if booked on other sites. Overall, it should not deter anyone from choosing this hotel. Overall, the Sofia is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Nicest Hotels I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: mattboone
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived the staff have gone out of their way to make sure we are well taken care of. I've stayed at numerous 4+ star rated hotels and although The Sofia is rated at 3.5 stars, it acts and feels like 4+ stars. The location is ideal. The staff is at the top of their game. I would come back here in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TracyHern
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews complaining about this hotel and have to say that I had the complete opposite experience. The service was impeccable, everyone was friendly and more than willing to help me find whatever I needed. Every time I picked up my car from valet they asked if I needed directions to where I was going. The front desk staff was friendly and greeted me every time I came in to the hotel. The concierge was great at telling me all about the tourist places I could visit. The location is ideal, within walking distance of the Gaslamp district. There is also a train station just two blocks from the hotel, so you can take a train to Old Town and the downtown areas if you don't want to walk (although it was called a "trolley" which makes it sound kind of quaint and old-world-style; it was really just a light rail, and when I was on it at night there were certainly some strange characters on with me). The rooms are fantastic; yes they are smaller than some hotels I have stayed in because it's a historical building and rooms were smaller when it was built, but come on people, you're in San Diego! Why are you hanging out in your rooms anyway? People who are worried about the size of their rooms should get out and DO something instead of hanging around all day in a hotel. They also have the added bonus of a mini fridge and a microwave, so I was able to save the leftovers from my favorite California restaurant (Vince's Spaghetti) and eat them the next day. The parking was $30 a night, but it was the same for pretty much all the hotels I looked at in the downtown area, so it's not outrageously high here versus other places. I was traveling for business, but I will definitely return here when I am back on vacation or in the future for other business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Decor”
Reviews.Author: kleverkira
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego to accompany my H who was there for a work-related conference taking place at the convention center. His other co-workers stayed at convention center hotels or in the Gaslamp Quarter. For slightly less money, we stayed at the Sofia, which was close walking-distance to absolutely everything we wanted to do while still being a little removed from the hectic noise of the Gaslamp. The rooms were pretty small, however. H and I are not particularly large people, but I could see bigger people being uncomfortable staying in these rooms. Since we weren't there a lot, it didn't matter. Plus, the rooms were designed nicely to maximize storage and work space with very modern decor and dark wood furnishings. The beds were comfortable enough. The view was of a bail bond shop, so that wasn't exactly ideal, but for the location, it was great. The one design flaw, which apparently isn't unique to the Sofia after talking to other conference participants, was the bathroom, which had only a 1/2 glass panel meaning that every time we took a shower, we flooded the bathroom. The other elements of the hotel - staff, gym, lobby, etc. exceeded expectations. The lobby was beautiful, and the staff were very friendly and remembered us when we would come in. The gym was small but had good equipment for lifting and cardio. There is also a special room for yoga, stretching, calisthenics, or doing exercise DVDs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: PDXtraveler281
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while attending a conference nearby. The price was much less than that at the conference hotel, and our room was nicer. It's an older, remodeled hotel with great attention to detail. The room had everything I needed, including micro, fridge and beautiful walk in shower. The desk and reading chair added a nice touch. Whoever designed the updated features really had good design sense of what is needed and how to squeeze it all in to a small space. Staff was very helpful in finding attractions, and they even loan out bikes and helmets for free. Great restaurant, too, though we only ate there once since meals were included in much of the conference agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, loud fan, insanely pricey valet”
Reviews.Author: Bluberychu
Reviews.Content: The room would have been a great value for the area. Although everything is exceptionally small it's in a great location and was worth the rate. However, the fan from the building below will not allow you to get any sleep! It constantly turns on and off. And I would not recommend valeting your vehicle. If you drove where are you to park then? Good luck figuring that much out. We ended up paying just as much for parking as it was for the room and didn't even know until we checked out! You think if you were going to charge that much you would make sure you sited the rates prior to taking somebody's keys!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but be aware of surroundings”
Reviews.Author: resilientmonkey1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The pluses are: 1. Coffeebean at the bottom of the hotel 2. Comfy bed Minuses 1. Greyhound station next door 2. Homeless milling outside the Coffeebean in the morning 3. Homeless in the area at night (throughout the day for that matter, but this is a San Diego problem, not just related to this hotel) 4. Historical preservation fee of close to $3 per night that they don't bother telling you about at check in. They like to spring it on you at check-out. 5. Small room

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chief025
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights. We found the hotel to be central to everything we planned to do.The local bus and trolley are near buy to take you anywhere you would decide to go. We took one of the on and off trolley tours for a few of the attractions we wanted to see. We were able to walk to Hortons' Plaza to catch it. San Diego had many homeless adults on the streets. None of them bothered us at all. We never heard the Greyhound buses many mentioned. We found the homeless people seemed to hangout up the street near 7-11 or across the street. The bus people seemed to be on the move all the time. Either arriving or departing. The concierge at The Sofia were all great people. Very polite and helpful. We actually took a fun tour thanks to Gabriels' advice. He recommended we take a tour to LaJolla. A local man named Tim does the tour. You need to book in advance. He will pick you up at the train depot. The tour last from 12:00 to 5:00. This allowed us to see the beautiful beaches and homes of LaJolla. Tim was very informative throughout the trip. He was willing to accommodate us in whatever we wanted to see in LaJolla. We found the hotel to be very clean. We felt all of the employees were some of the nicest we had ever encountered while traveling. The lemon water in the lobby was a nice touch after a long day of sightseeing.We highly recommend this hotel over the big chains in town.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: adphillips
Reviews.Content: From making my reservation to check-out my experience with the Sofia was absolutely wonderful. My husband and I were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and the Sofia was so sweet - champange & a card waiting for us in our room! Service was top notch, from the front desk to the valet. Location was perfect - walked to Gaslamp and Horton Plaza in just minutes. Will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vonygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! It is quiet and trendy. The room I stayed in this time was small, a little disappointed. The last time I stayed it was a large suite with 2 rooms. Both times the bed was very comfortable with nice soft sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable with Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: modesttraveller30s
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in the heart of San Diego and good value. The room was tastefully decorated and clean. Service was attentive; I left my shirt there and came back the next day and they had it wrapped up for me. The Internet was free and so was use of the business centre. They seem to care about the customer having a good experience and offer a free tour of the city as well. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach and some resolution”
Reviews.Author: jbaquir
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel over a weekend to celebrate my birthday. When we arrived the room was nice enough. They make the most of what little space the room has. The location is about 2-3 blocks away from the Gaslamp Quarter. I live in San Diego and I wouldn't consider the location ideal. Two blocks away is the county jail and all the bail bonds offices that come along with it. They only offer valet parking which at $30/night is very steep. Our first night in the room we were getting ready to meet up with some friends for dinner in the Gaslamp. As I was waiting for my girflriend to get ready I spotted a cockroach crawling across the wall. I called down to the front desk immediately and they informed they would send someone up to take care of it. About ten minutes later a maintenance man came with a bottle of insecticide. At this point the cockroach was in our curtains. He saw it and sprayed away but never did catch it or confirm its demise. Somehow the roach had gotten away. His response was "that should take care of it". Great, not only does the room now reek of insecticide but there's still the possibility there's a roach in the room somewhere. Anyway, I called down to the front desk again requesting another room. At first they said the hotel was sold out but they somehow managed to find us another room. Someone from the front desk came up to our room and gave us the keys to our new room as well as a couple of breakfast vouchers. We had to pack up again and move to another room. At this point we were about 30 minutes late in meeting our friends. In the end we never did use those breakfast vouchers. My girlfriend and I just weren't comfortable eating somewhere where we knew there were cockroaches. We ended up checking out one day early. I tried to recoup the rate for the night we weren't staying at the hotel as I prepaid for the room using Expedia but the gentleman at the front desk said he couldn't do that but gave me the business card of their front office manager to contact. I sent an email out to Kristi, the front office manager, voicing my displeasure and haven't received any kind of acknowledgement. By the way, the room with the cockroach was room 329. An "upgraded" room with a "city view". UPDATE: Two and a half weeks after my stay at the Sofia Hotel I finally received a reply from Kristi, the front office manager. They were able to refund me for the second night in which we didnâ€™t stay at their hotel and gave us a voucher for one complimentary night in a deluxe studio suite.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: CYANcrew
Reviews.Content: What a great location and a comfy room for a great deal. We booked 2 rooms and got nice ones for $82 with advance reservations. We walked all over and took the train when it was a longer trip and the hotel was so convenient. The tv, bed and shower was especially nice. I can't imagine a better bargain in town. Room was tight but it was a renovated hotel with new baths squeezed in and it was fine with us.

Reviews.Title: “A 12yr Wedding Anniversary to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Lokahi01
Reviews.Content: After reading a good share of reviews regarding the Sophia, my husband and I decided to stay here for our 12yr wedding anniversary. It turned out to be a weekend to remember. Check-in was smooth; the front desk staff was very friendly. However, we did get a room warned by previous reviewers - lower floor, facing another window, and chicken wire on the windows. We immediately asked for another room and the front desk staff was quick to accommodate. Quick tip: we asked for a king size bed which is why we got that view so if the view matters to you, be okay knowing you'll get a smaller full-size bed (which was fine because the bed is so comfortable, you hardly even move around!) Once we switched rooms, we were ecstatic. We had Room 630 and we had a partial pier view and could see the water from our bed! The rest of our stay could only be summed up with two words: exceptional service. Specifically, Barb who gave me the best massage I've ever had (try the crowning chakra) and who was genuinely excited for me to get this special massage to Cynthia, a wonderfully welcoming waitress at the Currant restaurant lobby level that made us feel so comfortable! Thank you to the staff of the Sophia Hotel. My husband and I will look back at fond memories of this anniversary and may even plan future stays on our special day. Thank you to all who gave past reviews to be able to make the best decision to stay here - I can only hope to return the favor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenient location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LJEBishop_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this distinctive, historic hotel for two nights and enjoyed it very much. Our cozy but comfortable room was reasonably priced for the area. We parked our car with valet upon arrival and then either walked or took the excellent public transportation everywhere we wanted to go. The harbor, the Gaslamp District, Horton Plaza, along with great restaurants and theaters are all within walking distance. It's fast and easy to catch a bus or a trolley to Balboa Park and Old Town. Our bed was supremely comfortable -- so much so that we slept 9+ hours each night! We also appreciated the free use of bicycles, the computers in the lobby with free internet access and the adults-only atmosphere. Finally, the hotel staff was friendly, professional and welcoming. Thanks for a great stay -- we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cute modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayla13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night before a flight home. It ended up being a really great find and would have gladly stayed longer. We got to the hotel quite early and were happy when they were able to let us check into our room so early. The room was cute, not as small as I was expecting based on other reviews. The shower set up caused some worry as the glass door only goes halfway so we were concerned with water splashing out all over but managed to keep it dry. Also the lighting is a bit too dim for putting on make up around the sink area. The location is good - close to Horton Plaza, Gaslamp Quarter, Little Italy, Seaport Village, and buses and trolleys are so close by that you can get anywhere else you need to easily.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pharmacy11
Reviews.Content: I hate to give anywhere a bad review. I can't say the Sophia is 'bad'. But the issues I have with it are: the rooms are TINY. There are just two of us in here and it's too cramped. We had never been to San Diego so we were unsure of locations. As with any downtown area in a big city- there are lots of homeless walking around. We live n a small town so it's not something we are used to. The parking is $30 a day and if u bring a pet it's $50 a day per pet. Then something we weren't told when booking- they charge $100 a night for accidentals that gets refunded a week or two after check out. For us, that's $700 plus our hotel rate. And when u don't have a credit card (just prefer not to use credit cards) that's a lot of money to just not have on vacation. The valet men are more than nice but I feel bad for not tipping, but at $30 a day- we can't afford to every time we come in or out. Sometimes I feel like they stand there like where's my tip? Lol. They are very nice and run to you when u pull up to open your door, etc. The front desk greets you every time you walk by. I just wish we would have stayed else where personally. Somewhere with a little breathing room and somewhere not downtown. Oh yea, the bathrooms! Talk about TINY. The shower doesn't even have a door or curtain. When we get done showering, the floor is like a swimming pool. They only give u one towel a person each day so that kinda sucks trying to clean the floor up when you have limited towels! Also on a day like today, after going to the zoo- I would enjoy a shower this evening. Just hate to constantly ask them to bring us more towels!

Reviews.Title: “Had some noise problems. I stayed a...”
Reviews.Author: mr_kuiper
Reviews.Content: Had some noise problems. I stayed a Sunday night at the Sofia hotel, which is well.located in downtown san Diego. (Hint: if you can be out by 8 am you can street park for free in the neighborhood.) Reserved on hotel website and was well received and given 2nd floor room on street side. Room with two double beds was furnished well but cramped. One bedside light burnt out and no toilet paper were an inconvenience. Hotel restaurant had a very reasonable happy hour fot light food and cocktails; the hotel.clearly had a young (low 20s) clientel. Street noise into room was fine (good windows) but walls were VERY thin. A party began at 10 in an adjacent room and pemitted only fitful sleep. Front desk did try to help with multiple (briefly obeyed) warnings but by 3:30 AM the staff provided access (free) to another room to finish out the short remaining night. Overall a sub-average experience in what looked to be a nice find.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vron23
Reviews.Content: The Sofia is a really nice hotel with all the ammenities you need (particularly when you are holidays). The Current bar and restaurant are also good, with happy hour between 4-7 every night!! It is in a great location, really close to great shopping at Horton Plaza in the Gaslamp District and easy access to buses to get to Balboa Park and the zoo. The only thing I will say is that at night, I didn't feel particularly safe in the area, a lot of homeless and street people, who I am sure are harmless, but as a solo female traveller, I didn't particularly enjoy walking around at night. There is also free Wi Fi access available in the foyer and the Current. Also I thought the customer service was great, helpful and always a greeting whenever you encountered a staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Customer Service Excellent”
Reviews.Author: katbar1
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviewa here. We arrived early- way before check in time -the front desk person greeted us with professionalism and promptly gave us our room key . Awesome service- great decor-clean room. The area where the hotel is located makes it easy to find shopping, eat, be entertained and walk to the beach within 10 mins or take buses to the zoo, seaworld or amtrack to wherever you want to go.. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: E39S62
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at this hotel and when we showed up the hotel overbooked us. It was about 6 pm at night and our credit card was already charged. We showed up, valeted our car (no self parking) to find out we had to go somewhere else. The hotel manager did not offer any future stay courtesy to us nor did they apologize. They just sent us to a Hilton across town. If we wanted to stay in a big corporate hotel, we would have booked with them. We chose this hotel because of its intimate atmosphere. What a disappointment since the hotel looked really nice and quaint. We are avid travelers and are constantly recommending hotels to our friends, family and co-workers. Too bad this hotel will be loosing a lot of our business.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Business Ladies!"”
Reviews.Author: kissacat
Reviews.Content: There is nothing positive about the "boutique-ness" of this boutique hotel. I have stayed in other "boutique" hotels before( such as the Ellis in Toronto-a delight) so I am aware of the small and quaint aspects this term refers. Yet, I was shocked when I entered my room to find how functionally useless it was...even for a small petite woman like myself. My first impression was the inside cabin of a low-budget cruise. The sink was located in a tight alcove in the corner of the room with an above-basin allowing NO space to place make-up or personals. I had to lay them behind the TV! The view faced the brick wall and back of another hotel. When air was on, the sound is like the engine room of a freighter, yet without the air one cannot breath (and it was not hot weather at all outside-just cannot open window). So, you choose sleep or no breathing. The location was NOT as close to the convention center as hoped. After a long walk to the convention and a full day of meetings and workshops, I look forward to returning to my hotel and relaxing,,,and I am not big on large and luxurious, just functional and unique. This hotel left me very uncomfortable. I would not recommend this location if your a business woman attending the convention.

Reviews.Title: “realy nice hotel. great location.”
Reviews.Author: pansburg
Reviews.Content: Super hotel. Outside looks older, but room was terrific. Clean and modern. A bit on the small side and walls a bit thin so sound travelled--but very nice overall. Great location. 5 minute walk to Gaslamp and 10 to convention center (a $7 cab ride).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price, perfect hotel for anyone's traveling needs.”
Reviews.Author: bennifered
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference down the street at the Grant. Perfect location. Loved the boutique feel of the hotel. Customer Service was very helpful and allowed me to check-in as soon as I arrived. No waiting. Enjoyed the business center and the gym at the hotel. Didn't eat dinner at restaurant but it looked nice. Was very close to mall, and other restaurants. Had perfect accomadations for a business trip and or vacation stay. Rooms were adaquate.

Reviews.Title: “Be Treated Like A Friend Not A Stranger”
Reviews.Author: BugsAward
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel stay I have had in a long, long, time. All the people there went the extra mile to accommodate our every need. Even our puppy was acknowledge on their Pet Guest Registry. Perfect location for any event in San Diego and Brian is unbeatable. Thank you again Brian. David Settani

Reviews.Title: “Service and quality impressive!!”
Reviews.Author: cap356
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofia when I came to a conference which was located at the San Diego Convention center. It was 5 blocks from the Convention Center which is a fine walk in the morning. But if you have stuff to carry it becomes a little difficult. The rooms are decorated with good taste--contemporary. But I was caught off guard by the showers with a half glass door! This made it difficult to keep the water off the floor. The rooms were very comfortable though on the small side. However, the staff and service were perfect! Definitely made it a treat to come back to the hotel every night. The valet staff was exceptional as well! They gave us great tips and places to visit. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Take Me home to The Sophia!”
Reviews.Author: RedStilettos
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay. After a couple of room changes I was quite happy with my room. Try to get a street view as opposed to the Greyhound station. The rooms are smal, but intimate. And why wouldn't you want to get out to see the city?? The shower spilled water out, but it wasn't a big deal. I'd like to suggest that free Internet be available in all the rooms. Many thanks to the front desk: Brian, Gina, Ben, Leah, and Matt. Best in the industry! And you MUST order the Wild Salmon Tartare from Currant! Mike at Currant makes wonderful vodka martinis, and Jeff was super to recommend Patrick II for some jazz/R&B in Gaslamp. The wait staff were tremendous...Omar, Sal, Jesus, and Nicole! I had been there in Mar 2008 & Omar STILL remembered me!!! Thank you everyone for making my stay unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “From check-in to check-out a wonderful experience...”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: From Mike the valet to Aaeron and Leah at the Front Desk to the sales manager Amy, this is a fantastic hotel. This was only the second time staying here, about a year ago, and even then some of the staff recognized me and the stay was excellent. Stayed in room 341, a suite, and it was like having an apartment away from home... close to everything, very quiet and peaceful, great amenities, great service, comfortable beds, etc. I would highly recommend choosing this property over many of the others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel303
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights during a business trip. I was somewhat hesitant due to the bus station next door but I'm happy that I made the decision to stay here. The room is very compact and similar to Manhattan hotels. The furnishings are very modern and the refrigerator comes in handy. San Diego, in general, has a huge homeless problem but I walked all over the city for six days and was never approached by anyone. The hotel is about 6 or 7 blocks from the convention center which takes 10-15 minutes to walk. The restaurant was a great place to wind down in the evening. They have a happy hour/late evening menu and the food is excellent and reasonably priced. There is a coffee shop directly next door and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Free internet access in the beautiful and relaxing lobby. I was able to utilize the Bristol Hotel's free internet from my room (depends on where you are located in the hotel). Parking is expensive but you don't need a car to get around San Diego. Take advantage of the free 1 hour walking tour on Sat and Sun mornings. Great history in the Gaslamp area. I will definitely stay here when I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and comfortable stay at the Sofia :)”
Reviews.Author: Al0ha81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sofia for 3 nights and I was very impressed with the hotel...it's a nice building and I really like the decor and modern feel to it. Just like the other reviews have stated, the location was awesome. Walking distance to all the major spots. We had a corner room on the 2nd floor with a queen size bed. I have no complaints about the size of the room, it was perfect for the two of us. We also had a great view of the city. I really loved the modern sink area and the beds were super comfortable. Make sure to check out the 'happy hour' downstairs at the restaurant Currant for some of the delicious drinks......something great to do before heading out for the night! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty rooms, and friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: ejablon09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our quick weekend getaway! The hotel is located right in downtown San Diego and the concierge was extremely helpful in pointing us in the right direction when we wanted to find some delicious dinner. The hotel is located right next to the Gaslamp District and Little Italy. The rooms were clean and everyone was friendly and cheerful (even when we were parking in the valet at midnight). Yes, the rooms are a little bit small, but beautifully designed with anything you could need. We'll definitely be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Boutique Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Canyonquest
Reviews.Content: The Sofia my favorite Boutique Hotel in San Diego and always my first choice for a place to stay. Rooms are well appointed and service is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: holleytaylor
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego quite a bit and I always stay downtown. This is definitely in my top 5 places there to stay. The great: You really can't beat the location. It's right across from the Gas Lamp district and it's a short walk to literally hundreds of great bars and restaurants and to Petco Park. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially the valets! It's nice to be greeted with such a friendly interaction on the way to work at 6 am. The styling is nice, casual contemporary style in the rooms, and the furniture and carpets all feel new and nice. The bed is the best. Period. It's got a relaxed, yet slightly upscale vibe without being snooty. It's not the party atmosphere of the W but it's more relaxed than, say, the super-fancy Westgate. I dig it. Internet was free and super fast! The okay: The rooms are a bit small (if you get a queen room, the king rooms are big) and the windows are small. The building isn't big (part of the charm) but don't go expecting a great view. It's also connected to the bus station, and you might here some street noise, but that's going to happen if you stay downtown. The parking is valet only, and is $30/night, but again, that's what you get when you stay downtown. This is pretty standard everywhere I stay in San Diego. I didn't see a room service menu, besides a drink list, but I didn't ask so I'm not sure if it's offered. All this said, though, it's pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Great value historical hotel in SD”
Reviews.Author: Shanecostamesa
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel mainly because we got a great rate through Expedia, however it was much better than I was expecting. The hotel is older, but was restored and has a nice style to it unlike newer hotels. They have small pictures on the walls showing old shots of the hotel was it was a long time ago. I also give this hotel high marks for service - you can take your pets with you here, and they had spare razors at the front desk when it turned out I had forgot mine. We also ventured out to Gaslamp for dinner, but as it turned out the Currant, the restaurant in the lobby, should not have been overlooked. It has a cool bar area with comfy, plush seats. They have some nice happy hour specials, and it's a nice alternative to hoofing it all the way down to the end of Gaslamp (esp. when crowded on the weekends). The only bummer is the number of homeless people seems to have spiked recently in downtown SD, but that's hardly the hotel's fault. Oh, and valet parking at $30 is the only option next to finding a lot somewhere nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: PhilMurray
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a conference. Paid about Â£60 per night. At this price its excellent value. I would definitely stay here again if on business in san diego. The room isn't huge but is very nice. More than adequately sized for me. Bathroom not drenched in water when turing on the showers (as other have previously complained). At worst it was a light spray around the opening of the shower. Location is OK. It is next to the greyhound and the courthouse but I never had any problems being hassled and didn't really notice any undesireable people. Its very close to the gaslamp quarter restaurants and about 15 minutes walk from the conference centre. Staff friendly and helpful. Good provision of ATM and vending machines for snacks. My only criticism was that the WiFi was free in lobby but not in room. When I looked there was no problem getting onto the computers in the business centre to check e-mail. Bus running to san diego zoo stops across street from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick531
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Sofia was wonderful! I was there on a business trip that involved me walking to the convention center, which was about a 10 minute walk away, very convenient. Just a couple blocks away was beautiful Horton Plaza and about zillion stores to shop in. Also, there were tons of great restaraunts right on 4th and 5th street which was also very close. The room itself was nice and very clean, it felt luxurious! The room was a little small for those looking for a lot of space, but I didn't need space since it was just me. The staff were knowledgable and friendly, and overall I really anjoyed my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Small But Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: jshelton22
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights through expedia at the Sofia during the Rock and Roll Marathon weekend. I only paid $72 a night which I think is unbelievable for the quality of this hotel. The rooms are small but there was a mini fridge/bar area, plenty of storage and a recliner. For two people it was perfect. I really liked the location too. We spent 3 nights in the Gaslamp so it was nice to split the time between two different areas. Some places to eat at nearby: Sushi Deli 2 (very cheap but go early bc there will be a line), Extrodinary Desserts (in little italy), Richard Walkers Pancake House. Horton Plaza Mall is basically across the street too. Spa Velia is a couple of blocks away and well worth it! My only complaint was the small tv. Out of the 3 hotels we stayed at in San Diego, this was my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PedroVieira
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Sofia Hotel for 3 nights. The location is great, and many of the city attractions are within a walking distante (Gaslamp district, Balboa Park and the Zoo, PETCO Park, Little Italy, among others). The room was very nice (we liked the decoration) and very quiet also. The service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hello Neighbor!”
Reviews.Author: BillFLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: In our first room we could here everything our neighbors said. The bathroom was esp. bad. It was like they were standing right next to you. So we complained and for 50 bucks more we got a suite. That was great but that is not what you get for the low price. Everything else about the hotel was awesome esp. the restaurant. We will go back there even if we dont stay at the Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a Good location”
Reviews.Author: JessTKY
Reviews.Content: Was there for work and only stayed there for two nights. Hotel is located in a pretty good location,. Didn't have time to explore San diego which was quite a pity. Hotel is located pretty close to Howard Plaza so was there for a stroll at night. Room is a bit small but since i am staying alone so no complaints. Free internet facility in the lobby which should come in handy for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Will certainly stay here again. I called...”
Reviews.Author: WheretoNextNewYork
Reviews.Content: Will certainly stay here again. I called to add an extra night to our stay and asked for the same low rate we had booked online months ago and was able to do so easily and gracefully. Check in and out was smooth and the map they provide is excellent. Room was well appointed and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place!”
Reviews.Author: BGIWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night Memorial Day Weekend. Nice location....very nice location. Opted for the valet parking which was $30. Reception very welcoming and check-in went smoothly. Our room didn't have a very nice view, but the room itself was very good. Living room with couch which turned into a pull-out sofa, two televisions, one in the bedroom, one in the living room. It had some wine (charge) and water (charge) available if we needed them. The hotel has a restaurant called Currant, we never ate there but the food smelled amazing. There's free wireless in the lobby as well. I'd recommend this hotel for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: Jsaint
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room at the Sofia in March 2010 and had an enjoyable stay. Yes the rooms are small and it was a little tight with two beds and two large suitcases but we really didn't spend a lot of time in the room so it didn't effect us too much. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean. Location wise, the Sofia is great, close to the trolleys, a short walk to the shopping centre (Macy's) and the Gaslamp and only 10 walk down to the water and the USS Midway and other boat tours. Staff were pleasant however not outstanding, they did check us in early which was nice. We got a free breakfast in the restaurant as part of the deal we booked. It was a substantial breakfast and service was good. The only issue we had with our stay was one night the people next to us decided to have a party in the hallway and their room but one call down to reception at 2am in the morning and they came up within 5 minutes and sorted it out.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel so highly rated on Trip Advisor?”
Reviews.Author: mrsindianajones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are regular San Diego visitors and we always stay downtown. We have stayed at the Omni and Hotel Solomar, which are our usual favorites. I know they are a higher class hotel than the Sofia, but with all the rave reviews we figured we wouldn't be sacrificing much, so we took a chance a booked the Sofia. We found an amazing deal through GetaRoom.com. For only $50 a night during Memorial Day weekend we didn't think we had anything to lose, but boy did we! First of all this hotel is right next to a Grey Hound Bus station, numerous bail bondsman's, and many many many bums. Usually this doesn't bother me in downtown San Diego, but this time it did, because this seems to be where they convene. When we pulled up the valet, which costs $30 per day, informed us the onsite parking garage was full and that our car would be parked three blocks away. Normally this wouldn't bother me, except that the neighborhood was so bad I found it unsettling. Again, my husband and I choose to stay downtown for the restaurants and night life. We walk around at night and I usually feel very safe, but I did not feel safe at the Sofia when I first arrived and I hoped this would be changed by the Zen like atmosphere that they advertise. All the staff at the hotel is very friendly and very professional. They act like they work at a nicer hotel than they do. A gentleman carried our bags in from the front door to the desk and the desk clerk was very hospitable. We asked for a room with a view if possible, but were told since we booked for 4 nights, there were none available. The lobby is very nice and well decorated, but it still has some of the hotel's classic charm. At this point my anxiety dropped slightly and I tried to have more of an open mind; however, that changed once we got into the elevators. They are so small if you have luggage and someone else is in there, wait for the next one and hope it's empty. This made me VERY nervous about the rooms and I had every right to be. If the elevators and hallways are compact, you better believe the rooms are. When we opened the door to our single queen room, I was horribly disappointed. The queen bed was the smallest queen I have ever laid eyes on. It literally took up all of the hotel room. The windows were covered with what looked like chicken wire (I guess to keep off the pigeon poop) and they didn't open, which was very needed in such a small space. Our room faced a parking lot for a Criminal Law office, not very San Diego like, and the room was not prepared very well for guests. The air wasn't on and it was incredibly stuffy (it took an hour to cool down), the tables were dusty, and the floor was dirty. The shower was a joke. Not at all feasible for such a small space. While it's pretty to look at, it floods the floor of this tiny bathroom that you can barely turn around in. I'm not sure about the square footage, but I would say these rooms are 200-250 SQ feet. I have stayed in bigger rooms in NYC and Seattle. They allow pets, but I don't know how a guest and Fido could fit comfortably in that room. In the end we ate the $250 and booked a room in Torrey Hills at the Hilton Garden Inn, which was a normal, clean, and comfortable hotel. I have never left a an already booked hotel in my life, but the Sofia was that unsatisfactory. If you're going to downtown San Diego to party and don't really care where you are sleeping this is the hotel for you; however, if you are looking for a relaxing San Diego vacation look elsewhere. Especially when the rates for this place go up this summer. There are many nice hotels downtown near Petco Park that have awesome accommodations and service.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but tiny”
Reviews.Author: jazzyclassical
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cute but there was hardly enough space to walk between the dresser and the bed. We stayed in a double. The beds were comfy enough. The shower had no door so the room got completely flooded by the time everyone took a shower. Room service was prompt. On a positive note, the hotel bar and restaurant was really nice. There is this state of the art gym with yoga room that really impressed. If I were to stay here again I would make sure I got a larger room if it exists.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jeaners2000
Reviews.Content: The Sofia hotel left me with mixed emotions. I booked this hotel at half the price and I feel that is what I got. I was there for a conference and decided that this hotel was suitable, since it was 4 blocks from the convention site. When I arrived at the airport I had to find another way to get to the Sofia (they provide no shuttle service). I checked into my room and the person who took care of me was very pleasant, but she forgot to return my credit card, my ID and didn't properly magnetize my room key. Which meant I had to make a double trip downstairs. She was nice enough to provide me with extra maps and directions. This doesn't really count as a negative toward this review. After I got into my room, I was surprised how big the bathroom was. But this might be due to the room being a corner room. The room was very clean, well decorated and comfortable. I had a small flat screen TV, with basic and some cable channels. The bathroom was stocked with towels and shampoo/soap. They had a working fridge with microwave and the bed was very comfy. The sheets were clean and the comforter was puffy and soft. I was really happy upon entering (the positive). Then I found out that internet was 9.95 a day, but it's free in the lobby. Which would explain why everyone was downstairs with their computers. Bummer. Considering my friends at the Best Western across the street had it in their room for FREE. My first night was pleasant , until 7am the next morning. You see, the Sofia is located next to the Greyhound station and because my room is located right next to the station, I could hear the buses coming and going at 7am! So if you want to sleep in late, tell them you DO NOT want to face the Greyhound station. Lucky for me, I had to get up by that time for the conference (the negative). The hotel is located really close to the Horton Mall, which is great if you forget anything! They also provide massages and yoga, which is great to relax in your hotel. It is also within walking distance from the Gaslamp district and the baseball stadium (the positive) So to wrap it up.. POSITIVE: room was clean and nicely decorated , service was nice, location was great! NEGATIVE: pay for internet in your room and loud greyhound buses next door. Overall, I would stay there again for the same rate I paid, but I would be picky on the room location.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoofan
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ The Sofia Hotel from April 27 to May 4 inclusive.....what a wonderful experience!!!! I had read negative reviews from previous guests about the size (small) of the rooms, and also the hotel's location next to the Greyhound Bus Station, but the overall reviews were very positive. I was more than pleasantly surprised with my spacious elegantly decorated standard bedroom. The bed was the incredibly comfortable !!! I ate breakfast and dinner in the hotel's restaurant each day......the food was excellent and the waitstaff were all very helpful and informative. In fact, all the staff that I came into contact with were very warm and friendly. The hotel's location is excellent, and I found no negativity with it being next to the Greyhound Bus station. This was my first visit to San Diego, and I'm certainly hoping to visit again..and will definately stay @ The Sofia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ANGHARRAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofia for 6 nights in April with our children aged 15 and 20 in one room! It was a little on the snug side but beautifully appointed and the staff were very thorough cleaning the room each day. We had breakfast in the restaurant whic we found to be good value.There was a good choice and it was well presented.Excellent coffee. My son also appreciated the free internet access. As per all the other reviews the hotel is well located for restaurants and we ate either in the gaslight area or little Italy in the evenings.The free one hour walking tour which the hotel provides on the weekend is well worth taking. Although we didn't have a car we managed to get to Sea world /the old town and San Diego zoo very easily as the trolley stops are very close to the hotel. The railway station is also within walking distance as we had come from L.A. by train The staff at the Tourist information which is situated on the same road as the hotel but close to the harbour were very helpful and it was worth buying a ticket there for the zoo as it was a reduced price and came with a few added extras. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: willth78
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything what you need from a city hotel! Don't get a room facing the bus terminal in the back if the building. It's not noisy, just ugly.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in downtown san diego”
Reviews.Author: cmen54
Reviews.Content: the sofia hotel overall was very nice. it's located downtown near the gaslamp district so if your going there for the nightlife,the sofia would be a very good option. the rooms are very unique and pretty but because it was built in 1927,the rooms are very tiny..our original room was so small we had to get an upgrade to a suite which was a faily decent size with a bedroom the size of our original room plus a little living room area with with a couch and 2 chairs with ottomans. one thing i didn't like were that the beaches were a 20 dollar cab ride away. also there are loads of homeless people walking around all over the place, not that the hotel can do anything about that. it also would have been nice if there was a swimming pool but it wouldnt have been a problem if the ocean water wasn't so cold. the currant restaurant inside had very good food.. we only ate there for breakfast which was good but quite pricey. besides all the bars in the gaslamp district it also had a nice mall in the horton plaza about 2 blocks from the sofia around the nbc building. also if you want to see the padres play it's a mile walk to the stadium or an 8 dollar cab ride so that was pretty cool. you can also walk to seaport village which has a ton of little shops from san diego souvineers to antique stuff. the hotel itself was very clean and the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. they have maps of all the districts and show you everywhere u want to go. they have a fitness center and an onsite spa. if you want to go to sea world of the san diego zoo, it will be a pricey cab ride away. i recommend taking the old town trolley for $34 per person it will take you to coronado,the gaslamp,seaport village,balboa park,little italy, old town and a few other places and you can get off at any stop and a bus comes every half hour to take you to the next stop..from the sofia you can get on at horton plaza..this is nice because you can see everything in san diego and because cab rides will add up fast, you can determine which places you would like to go back to and spend the day.. overall, i would recommend the sofia hotel,especially if you go there for the nightlife..if you want to be a beach bum then i would say stay in coronado or somewhere near mission beach.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-Compact four star.”
Reviews.Author: TowerBridge
Reviews.Content: Well located on Broadway 100 yards from Horton Plaza, 10 minute (slow) walk to Convention center, 5 minute walk to loads of good restaurants (see my review of Richard Walker's Pancake House). Lobby well staffed and friendly. Rooms couldn't be much smaller. About the same size as a cruise ship cabin with taller ceilings, bathroom has to have a sliding door as a normal door wouldn't fit. Room spotless, crisp snowy linens, dark stained wood, beige walls. Very "Interior Decorator", and lovely. Three computer business center with printer has free access but can get crowded. WI FI in lobby only, room access $9.95 per day. Prices good for San Diego. We got a "48 hour 1/2 price Sale" on line matched by the hotel, $87. In May we go back with 30% off, $104, for a convention. Parking $30 a night, it would make sense to find somewhere else for your car. No daily newspaper, a minor irritation. Would be a nice enhancement. Overall very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, But It Did The Trick”
Reviews.Author: TravelsMyMidleName
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel greets you with a $30 Valet Parking per night fee. Since The Sofia is smack-dab in the middle of downtown and there are no other parking facilities that I would suggest to ensure your cars safety. Checking in was a breeze and after seeing the amount of luggage we had, the bellhop suggested we upgrade to a suite. Because we got such a great rate by booking directly with the hotel (less than $70 per night) we decided to upgrade for an additonal $30 per night. At this rate, we were still ahead of comparable hotels in the area. Arriving in the room, we were glad we decided to upgrade. Yes, the rooms are "cozy", but the feel of the suite gave our 19-month old son more room to play. Without the upgrade, it would have been too cramped. The Sofia may be best for those singles traveling on business or for the couple who are only staying one or two nights. The business center (read: room) allowed for a quick check of the email. Wireless is not available in the room and the rate is $10 per day. Use the business room if you don't plan on putting this overpriced charge on your expense account. The bed was very comfortable, albeit a Queen, and the decor added a nice touch. Especially the microwave and mini-fridge which is a must when traveling with a toddler. The towels were above average for hotel quality. We did not eat at Currant, but there are plenty food options nearby. The hotel is near a bus terminal with many vagrants about, but do not let this change your mind about staying at The Sofia. Travel to the Zoo, La Jolla, Tijuana, were all within 20 minute drive. The airport is 10 minutes away and The Horton Mall is just a block away. We would more than likely stay again, if we were in San Diego. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are so small you have to go outside to change your mind!"”
Reviews.Author: gerronimo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located downtown. The decor is tasteful, Staff very good. However, it's all about the room and theses rooms are the smallest I have ever been in. You actually walk through the ront door, through the tiny bathroom, t get o the room. Too much furniture. To get out of bed you almost crawl over a lounge chair to touch the floor. The bathroom is way too small and you are right next to the front door. The toilet has very itlle privacy. Would not stay here again. Unfortunate since they tried so hard to make it a nice place. Like I said, it's all about the room and this one is just too darn small. And they charge $30/night for parking as well as a surcharge for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great first San Diego trip at the Sofia”
Reviews.Author: jhanseling
Reviews.Content: I traveled to a business conference in San Diego and stayed at the Sofia, where my employer had booked me at. The downtown location is great, and is easy walking distance to local restaurants, bars and shops. The hotel was nicely appointed, and the staff at the front desk was warm and friendly. I checked into my room early with no issues. The room itself was on the cozy side, but I found the room to be more than adequate for someone like myself, traveling solo on business. The building is an older hotel, but has been updated and looks great. My room was clean and very easy to navigate and find everything I needed. I had a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, safe, ironing board and iron, etc. Everything a business traveler would need. The only reason I did not give the room a full 5 star rating was because it was a little on the small side, and with the bed and other furniture it was a little difficult to navigate around the room. Overall I was very pleased with my stay at the Sofia, and would gladly recommend this hotel to future travelers, personal or business minded. This was my first trip to San Diego and I felt right at home thanks to the Sofia and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place.”
Reviews.Author: Soon2BEmptyNester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofia Feb 9-12 with my husband who was attending a trade show at the convention center. We arrived early (12 noon) and were able to check in with no problem. Rooms were pretty small as mentioned in other reviews, but had a nice contemporary feel. We were really only in the room to sleep so the smallness was not an issue. The room had an ipod docking clock by the bed, wine glasses, glass coffee mugs, wine opener, microwave, refrigerator, and coffeepot. We did buy a bottle of wine and some cheese to enjoy in the room before dinner and was nice to have a place to keep them cold. The pillows on the bed are pretty big (full) but after the first night I called the front desk and asked for some smaller, less stuffed ones, and they brought some right up. I used the fitness center one morning. It had a couple of treadmills, elipiticals, some machines, and free weights. There is also an attached "yoga" room. There is a restaurant/bar in the hotel "Current" that we had drinks at a couple of times, and hubby had breakfast there. There is also a coffee shop in the corner of the hotel. 7 Eleven is just down the street if you want a less expensive cup of coffee and budget breakfast. The walk to the convention center was easy as was the walk to all the fabulous restaurants in the Gaslamp area. (We were not bothered by any homless people.) We really enjoyed Fred's Mexican Cafe - Taco Tuesdays are cheap margaritas and EXCELLENT fish (an other) tacos. Also went to Donovans- wonderful steaks and if you call they will pick you up and take you back to hotel in their very luxerious van, and Blue Point for great seafood. This was our first trip to San Diego and we hope to return soon and do some more exploring. If you just need a nice place to sleep and not looking for a water view, then this hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: flossyfizzdog
Reviews.Content: We used the Sofia as our base for three nights after a cruise. We were able to check in early, which was fantastic (11am!). Our room was cosy in extreme, and if natural light is important to you, you might want to let them know, as our room looked on to a wall and was the darkest hotel room I've ever stayed in. The bathroom was split into shower (small but powerful) and toilet in one room, with some nice amenities, and the basin and mirror were in the entryway, right by the door, which felt odd, but didn't really bother us. The bed was comfortable, however the airconditioning couldn't be set to less than 18C, which was rather warm at night, and you can't open the window. Free wifi and computer room in the lobby was handy, and we had one free breakfast (very limited but adequate) that was part of a book-online promo at the downstairs restaurant, Currant. We also had dinner here with friends on our last night, and while the food was very good (try the flavoured popcorn - we had parmesan-caper...mmmmmmmm!), the service was a bit of a shock. The hotel has, however, since apologised, and I expect the person in question was just having a bad day. If you love pizza, do try Sammy's round the corner on 4th - the service there was exceptional. With Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp district within a block or two, the location is excellent, and the very helpful concierge was terrific helping us get to Balboa Park by bus - was easy! Overall the Sofia represents excellent value, just remember - the rooms are small!

Reviews.Title: “Only place I'll stay in San Diego, wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: annalg111
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 10 days on the west coast, traveling from Vegas to Anaheim, San Deigo, L.A., Flagstaff, Grand Canyon and back to Vegas. This was one of the best hotels we stayed in, the only competition being the Penthouse at the RIO Las Vegas. The beds were THE most comfortable of any hotel I've stayed in and I do travel quiet a lot. The hotel was so very cozy. The rooms were small, but plenty of room for my boyfriend and I to be comfortable, it felt more COZY than small, I loved it. The bathrooms were beautiful. I love the hotel and my only complaint was that I couldn't stay longer. I love the staff, absolutly wonderful and the restaurant connected to the hotel was great. We were looking for lunch between hours and only 2 or 3 staff members were there, they invited us in during their closed hours, AMAZING food, gave us great advice and the maÃ®tre d' even gave us some coupons he had to the zoo and great adivice on where to go. There is nowhere else I'd stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: sctrojan1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked-in all the staff were great. They allowed us to check-in early. The staff took time to give us a map and point out highlights of the area and even suggested restaurants. The hotel map was nice since it listed restaurants. The valet were always quick- no waiting. The hotel is right next to the Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp. There is a restaurant connected to the hotel that serves food all day (Currant). Also on the ground floor of the hotel are Coffee Bean and Pizza Hut. The only downside is that the rooms are small. Even the TV is small (i think a 20-inch LCD) They make good use of the space though. What I really liked was that there was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. The shower is weird because there is no door or curtain, so you have to keep the water pressure low to keep from splashing outside. the shower. The ice machine and snacks machine alternate floors, but are easily accessible since the are a couple stairways on each floor. Although the elevators were small, there was no problem waiting for elevators. The beds were very comfortable and had plenty of pillows. All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great location”
Reviews.Author: gigiof
Reviews.Content: Everything good in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place in the heart of San Diego Ca”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisKenH
Reviews.Content: My recent visit/stay in San Diego, Ca was wonderful and enjoyed all the 8 nights at, The Sofia Hotel :). Front desk services and hotel staff at The Sofia Hotel were excellent, excellent, throughout the entire hotel and stay. The Sofia Hotel is centrally located, within walking distance of everything downtown. Lobby was comfortable, free internet in the lobby only :(. The Sofia Hotel had available internet access in the rooms but had an expensive daily surcharge :(. One reasonable surcharge would have been great but surcharge per day :(. Seems like in this visit to San Diego Ca., the area of town has cleaned up their act in controlling all the beggars/paupers/homeless. Some years ago visiting San Diego all these people were slumping over tables and benches in this particular area, of course all cities have these particular issues. Even at that seem to be very safe area since I walked everywhere, even after dark, had no problems :). Otherwise, the room was nice, a bit small but quite at night, I would overall give, The Sofia Hotel a thumbs-up :) I will be back again :)

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tieko
Reviews.Content: Congratulations for the sofia! Its a spetacula r boutique in the best place of San diego. Only a few minutes fron Gaslamp and Horton Plaza! The taxi from the airport is only 15 dollars! The room is small but bigger than NY hotels! We made the check in ealier, the room is very clean and we didnt have any problem with them. The price is very good, remembering that you are in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “nicely renovated with a bit of character, but...”
Reviews.Author: Flipje67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last three nights of a two-week long multi-city US business trip. I was somewhat jaded with living out of a suitcase and pretty tired when I got here, but the staff on the front desk were welcoming and friendly. Also, luckily they had a room already ready early. I was warned that it wasn't the best room in the property - but hey, an early check-in was more important at that time. No view from the room apart from straight into a wall/window of another room (I was warned so can't complain). The room was on the small side for a US hotel - but perfectly adequate for one (or a couple). Queen bed, small desk, hanging space with wash basin in the corner and only a shower (fine for me) no tub. Fridge and microwave (handy for a slob 'night-in' when you just don't fancy another restaurant meal out!). Gaslamp district with its attractions a few minutes walk, and the convention centre probably about 15 minutes walk - which in San Diego weather is just right. On top of the no view issue with the room - I also found it quite noisy - even with the airco off there was a rather loud buzz/hum all the time I think due to airco system in other rooms? Bed was comfy though and I was very tired - so I slept fine in the end. Guests with sensitive ears - take ear plugs! Hotel restaurant and bar - OK. Very friendly staff (chef in particular) and the cocktails were great. Very nice gym facility with a small yoga studio (though not sure they actually have classes - but there were some yoga DVDS you could select yourself). Overall, a nice conversion of a historic building. Gave it some character over other big chain hotels I've stayed in before in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel is located in downtown San Diego. Greyhound station and Westfield Shopping Center is near by. There's valet parking (about 30 $ pr. day). There's a business center with 3-4 computers with free internet access. The room was nice and clean, but small. You CANNOT close the door to the toilet properly (it is a sliding door)! Be aware!

Reviews.Title: “stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: arlenetravels
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The room was small, but beautiful. And it had everything you need. Really nice bathroom. Downtown location is great--you can walk to everything. And they generally have really reasonable rates too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cqfp123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights while attending a convention.
