Excellent location in the Gaslamp district, a 15-minute walk from the Convention Center and a short walk from tens of restaurants. Clean, modern decor. Rooms are well designed with very comfortable beds, refrigerator, microwave, even though not a lot of extra space. Excellent on-site 24-hour fitness room. Free WiFi in the lobby (not in the rooms though). Very reasonable rates compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service.”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaAdventures
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Diego at 11am. We decided to just drop off our luggage at the hotel, since it was to early to check in, and explore. Well imagine our surprise, when we were allowed to check in early! After the long flight, we really needed to clean up so this was a welcomed surprise. We were given a room on the top floor (7) and found the room to be perfect for what we needed. Plenty of room to move about, plenty of closet and drawer space for our 3 days planned in SD. The bed, pillows, and bedding were very clean, soft, and made for a comfortable nights sleep. I loved the swanky style the room had to it. The mini fridge and microwave came in handy. The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but served it's purpose. The staff was always polite and gave great service with a smile. I placed a request for a wake up call on our last evening and had no problems. We did take the time to talk to the concierge for some advise and he was very polite, professional, and went above and beyond by making several phone calls himself to the sailing schools for us. He did give us a few tips on happy hours that were most appreciated. I felt like the staff at Sofia did a great job at making me feel comfortable and content. We really enjoyed the hotel and the location was perfect for walking the Gaslamp district. Not to mention it was very close to the trolley station and bus stops. I liked that they was always 24 hour cab service available, which came in handy when we left for the airport at 5am. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Sofia!”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofia Hotel for one night in October but I wish we could have stayed longer. The location is great, walking distance to gaslamp, the harbor, Little Italy - so many great places right nearby. It's also on the busline if you want to go further. The room was small but not as small as I expected after reading some of the reviews. It didn't feel cramped as it was designed well to accommodate everything. If a pocket door on the bathroom is a big deal to you then this probably isn't the type of hotel you'd like in the first place. And the view is pretty much non-existent (you just look at the building or the parking lot of you get a room in back) but if you want scenery, go outside. The bed was very comfortable and it was great having a fridge and microwave in the room. The hotel was very quiet and we were on the top floor so we never heard any street noise at all. The shower was kinda weird, I'll agree with other reviewers on that. There is no way to close it off so water will get on the floor. I laid a hand towel down to catch the water and it was fine. My only complaint would be that the drinking water in the lobby was WAY to lemony. It was like drinking lemonade with no sugar. You don't need to many lemons in there you guys! But this is a very minor thing and in no way affected my stay. Just thought I'd mention it. Overall I loved the Sofia and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Majykgal
Reviews.Content: Hotel reminds me of the great European boutique hotels. Room was small but had everything - fridge, microwave, safe. good lighting. Very nice, 24 hour fitness room with bottles of water. On site bar and restaurant with inventive happy hour specials. Location was great - very close to Horton Plaza, about 5-8 blocks to Gaslight and Convention Center. My only complaint is walls are a bit thin - hope you don't have a loud neighbor. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WIsconsinTravelerToo
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern, clean, and very comfortable, but small. If you need space, this hotel is not for you. The bathroom had a large shower stall, but no tub. The complimentary toiletries were quite nice. The front desk staff were friendly and welcoming. It is a little bit of a hike to the convention center as it is on the edge of the Gaslamp district, so bring sensible shoes. I stayed there twice in June. I now receive emails on rate promotions and coupons for discounts. If business takes me to San Diego again, The Sofia Hotel will be my destination.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and cozy hotel, right in the heart of downtown!”
Reviews.Author: dragonette17
Reviews.Content: My husband, two friends and I recently stayed three nights at the Sofia hotel in San Diego's famous Gaslamp Quarter. We enjoyed it very much for the following reasons: -Prime location for walking to Horton Plaza and 5th street for nightlife and dining. -Small rooms are very cleverly used. They are chic and efficient. -Quiet at night! I was never bothered by hallway traffic during the night. The only "complaint" isn't really a complaint... but just a reality. The hotel is valet only at $28 per night. Those who know San Diego know there is no such thing as free and convenient parking there... so just plan for the valet and enjoy not having to fight for a parking spot.

Reviews.Title: “The very definition of 'boutique' with a cozy room and cleanliness as #1.”
Reviews.Author: WestwoodPark
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Hotel Sofia numerous times when visiting San Diego for business. It's a little further from the convention center (and convention hotels) than most are used to, but the walk (or cab ride) is simple and relatively speedy...and the cost savings are definitely worth it. The rooms are cozy and nicely equipped with supreme high-speed internet access, a super-comfortable bed and bedding, and a SUPER-CLEAN atmosphere. The staff is friendly and polite to a fault.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, ultra-luxe rooms, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofia while attending a convention at the San Diego Convention Center and absolutely loved the hotel. The hotel has a historic look/feel in the exterior, yet classic/cozy feel in the lobby and public areas. We stayed in one of the suites, and everything was nicer than any other 4 diamond or 4 star property I've stayed at in a long time. If you have a chance try the restaurant - I had breakfast there (really good) and happy hour (also really good and reasonably priced). I lost my voice while there, and cannot remember the name of the server in the restaurant, but he went out of his way to give me hot tea, lemon and tons of honey.... without asking, he anticipated my needs and exceeded my expectations - an excellent sign of a well-run property. Oh, and the front desk staff was excellent as well - very professional, courteous, and always said hello every time I walked by. Ah, location! Almost forgot - you just walk across the street for the main shopping center, and just down the street is the main drag of the gaslamp district, and just beyond that, the convention center... everything is within walking distance. I ate an incredible dinner at "Acqua Al 2", which is my new favorite restaurant in San Diego. Check it out. Hope this helps - book the Sofia and you'll be very pleased...

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: bluemaxie
Reviews.Content: stayed for one week end of september,every thing was good ,front desk staff, maids,in fact anyone we came in contact with,nothing was too much trouble

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING HOTEL IN A GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DWolf1
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel was recently renovated, and is comfortable in every aspect. The single Queen room was large enough for two to stay comfortably. The shower was great - though the European style shower door allows water to escape onto the floor. The room was quiet and temperature control worked well. The television remote control was slow to respond, and we later learned it had something to do with blocking the electronically controlled safe - which seems strange, but may be worth remembering. Our room came with breakfast coupons, which entitled us to one "special" 2 egg breakfast, no substitutions. The restaurant has outdoor seating which was a nice place to start the day. Parking was $28 per night. San Diego has great public transportation, so if you don't need a car, your savings will be significant.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjones01
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a loooong drive and were pleasantly surprised that the staff let us check in very early. I mean HOURS early. Very nice, understanding and accomodating. They got us into our beds quickly but, made sure we knew that we were welcome to come down and ask questions about San Diego, tours, eats etc... Thank goodness, we were exhausted. We could not have been more pleased with the service the whole weekend. Every staff member we came in contact with was cheerful and willing to assist in any way. The hotel itself is lovely! The beds are comfortable with a ton of pillow choices. The decor is chic and modern but, not cold by use of a warm color scheme. The buliding is old but you don't feel it. It is very charming. The perfect location if you like to walk... we do. You can get to the mall, pier, and gas lamp district easily. (We parked on Saturday morning and did not need our car again until Monday afternoon!) Stop by the great cafe downstairs; yummy breakfast and a cool late night happy hour. Let me tell you, the breeze on the patio is incredile. Anway, we really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend the hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ITop_CatI
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant, The Staff almost fell over them selves to help you, The room was gorgeous, and bed was comfortable, and the food in the resturaunt was Scrumptious! I Would highly recomend this hotel! And if you are staying here be sure to try the Sushi at the sushi place across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Dean/Caroline
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, they have Valet parking for $28 a day totally worth every penny. The city is so easy to drive around in. Traffic never got bad. The hotel is a historic building and has so much charm. The staff were terrific. I will go back. They have a spa in the hotel and it is close to amazing restaurants on fourth street. The only thing to watch out for is tones of homeless people begging you for money. They hang out here because all the rich people are here. Lots of shopping across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Sofia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nipper100
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at this hotel and loved every aspect. Rooms were modern and very clean. Friendly staff were always willing to help out with a smile. Walking distance to everything (Petco Park, Shopping Mall, Gaslight District, Seaport Village, Amtrak and the Metro). For the price we paid, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “La bella Sofia...a gem.”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: I have been going to San Diego EVERY week for the last 3 months. Each week I have tried a different hotel and my girlfriend suggested we try this one for last weekend. This is a European boutique hotel. The rooms are small, yet ingeniously designed to make it feel just right. The service is stellar. The restaurant downstairs has great food and service. We were there for one night and then drove up to Santa Barbara. Coming back to San Diego, I missed my flight and we decided to stay here another night. It was perfect yet again. Rates are very competitive. They have a special for returning visitors so make sure you mention that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern hotel, friendly staff but small room”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterChuffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of July. The hotel & rooms are very modern & clean. Room was very small but we werenâ€™t staying in it much so didnâ€™t matter. The hotel is in a great location very near to the harbour (nice fish restaurants, bars), Gaslamp Area & Horton Plaza (shopping centre). The area seems very safe but there was a lot of homeless people throughout the whole of the city â€“ not just near the hotel which is a criticism of San Diego not the hotel. On a negative point you have to pay for Valet parking which we didnâ€™t have to in any of the other 11 hotels on our whole trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JLS300
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at the Sofia, and was extremely pleased with almost every aspect of the hotel. Check in was easy, as was check out. Rooms, while on the small side, are clean, well equipped and comfortable. Great design is carried out through the lobby and bar/restaurant. All staff we spoke with were nice and helpful. Food in the restaurant was ok-I love chicken and waffles and it was too bad the selection here didn't meet expectations. There are some computers off to the side of the lobby that were great to use to print boarding passes. Location is great, and felt safe walking the 2 blocks to Horton Plaza and the 3 blocks to the W for a party.Agreed-having the Greyhound station on the same block and the jail up the other block could put off some people, but never an issue. All in all a great place to stay. Only complaint? No pool.

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose!”
Reviews.Author: haisurfboards
Reviews.Content: Some advice: book your room at The Sofia WITH THEM, not thru a third party, or via. a website. Do your research, find the best price, then CALL THEM DIRECTLY. You will get someone at the front desk (supervisor/assistant manager), and tell them the price you found and offer them the chance to "beat the price." They will, usually by 10 dollars or so. In turn, you get a great deal at a clean, newly remodeled, modern hotel in a FANTASTIC location. The rooms are very clean, though VERY small. We're talking 8X8 kind of small. The sink is right next to the door to the hotel hallway because they can't fit them anywhere else in these tiny rooms. The shower however, is roomy and incredibly nice. I took a 20 minute shower and never wanted to get out. Well done there, Sofia! The AC is sort of temperamental, so that's annoying. The beds are comfy, but like others said...THE PILLOWS SUCK! Bad: Crappy Pillows, Tiny Cramped Rooms, Temperamental AC. Good: PRICE, Location, Very Clean, New, Showers! Good place to stay, if you book here you will have a nice sleep and limited anxiety going into your trip. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone that is obese, especially if you're a couple. Two BIG people in these rooms wouldn't work, it just wouldn't. Have fun in SD! Downtown SD is an awesome place.

Reviews.Title: “My new San Diego home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: krtravelpro
Reviews.Content: I just returned from San Diego and still have a smile on my face when I think of the lovely little hotel in the city called the Sofia. When I found it online, I was a bit concerned I'd end up experiencing a boutique which was trying to be trendy and hip and not simply cozy and comfortable like I was hoping. Boy, were my slight concerns in this regard unwarranted, I am so happy to say. What I found out was that the staff, atmosphere, amenities and overall feel were outstanding and wonderful and make me want to go back soon! Let me share a few details and try to paint the picture as to why I liked it so much. There is much about which I'd like to elaborate, but I'll try to summarize as succienctly as I am able. Before I even committed to booking my room on the phone (and trust me, its worth it to do this rather than simply take the best rate you can find online), I found such helpfulness from the young lady named Amanda in explaining the rooms and rates available. She was so friendly and extremely patient with my many questions and attempts to find a way to reduce the rate just a bit more than what I found online. She was able to do so after I coaxed her just enough, but she never once made me feel I was keeping her too long. Next, on the night of my arrival, I was treated to such a wonderful welcome and very effecient service by Selma at the front desk. She made me feel I was being hosted by a friendly aquaintance, not just another hotel employee "doing the job" with here genuinely warm and friendly manner. She anticipated my needs and had helped me on the phone before arrival by reading off menu items from the Currant Restaurant on property and had my food prepared and waiting when I arrived to check in! This was her suggestion on the phone when she realized I was running late and might miss a late dinner when I mentioned I was hungry and figuring out options. She also assisted me with parking ideas and introduced me to the bellman Daniel, who was also extremely friendly and helpful while I ate before getting back to my vehicle to park it. During my stay, Autumn at the desk was also such a peach and a friendly assistant. She printed off directions to Coronado while I was gabbing away with Selma again and then the next day acted as my bellperson and check out host at the same time while the other bellman was at lunch. She was so cheeful, patient and an enjoyable person with whom to converse and I still can see her bright smile in my mind. Kudos to Christian the dest manager, too, as he was helpful, effiecient and friendly as well! If you have not already figured it out, the staff is perhaps my favorit thing about the hotel. But let me say a bit more about the facility itself. For the money you pay, which is reasonable already, you get a nice fitness center and useful computers and printer at the business center. The feeling all around hotel is clean, cozy and relaxed. The atmosphere is charming. The furnishings are contemporary and comfortable. I did like the room, although it was pretty small, but I knew that coming in and could have paid more for a larger suite. However, the room had everything you need including a small fridge, microwave, flat screen TV and even extra wine, beer and coffee glasses which were real glass, not plastic or cheap. The beds are divine - so very comfortable. The sleep cover and top sheet were a bit short for a queen bed in my opinion and at only 6' tall, my feet stuck out a bit. But the housekeeping staff gave me a king size the next day which helped. The one thing which was really strange about the room was the shower set up, which is common in many of the rooms. It has no door or curtain, so water goes all over the floor and toilet area, which makes a mess to dry up. However, I just asked for more towles and put them down the next time. I'd rather not have to do it, after falling in love with other aspects of the hotel I would put up with it again. Anyone looking to stay here must realize the benefits and challenges of the location. You are pretty centrally located downtown and other parts of the city are easily accessible by car or public transporation. It's in an area focused on business as much as tourism. However, there are nice restaurants nearby in the Gaslamp area and even just in the general blocks not far away. The food I had at the Currant restaurant in the hotel was pretty good, but I need to eat there more to give it a real review. I must say my waiter was very hard working and accomodated all of my detalied requests happily. But the biggest challenge downtown is parking. You either have to find a pay lot, run back and forth to meters in the daytime, or pay $28 for valet parking at the hotel. I was trying to save money for other activities, so I used a pay lot about 5 blocks away and had to go back and forth a few times to make sure I was not ticketed. But it was only $3-5 and mostly overnight, as I was out and doing things in the daytime. So, just know what you are getting into and then make your choice. I'm giving it 5 stars because I'm extremely happy with my stay overall. Perhaps I'd give it 4.5 if I could, only because I think it's only fair to point out the few small things I'd prefer were different like the shower set up and the parking costs/hassle. However, knowing those things going in now, I'd still stay there anytime. As my headline reads, I think I've found a home away from home here!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolajones
Reviews.Content: I had to switch hotels because of a cancelled flight and my hotel wouldn't give me a better price. I first checked online and saw that the cheapest room would cost me $111 and then I spoke with them and asked them if they could do better and they charged me $99. I was staying at Holiday Inn on The Bay and they wanted to charge me $150 which I could of stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel! I would have stayed at the Hard Rock but since this was not a plan to stay the extra two days I opted for the cheaper room. They were very nice and the place was really cute! It is a historical hotel so it has little touches of classic architechture but they modernized it. The room was really tiny. I don't mind that but some people might. They had a microwave and refrigerator. The bed was sooo comfortable!!! The only thing I didn't like was that the shower only had one glass door and it didn't slide which meant the water got on the bathroom floor. They have a nice business area with three computers and no time limit. There is a restaurant attached to it. It has gotten great reviews. My boyfriend and I were too late for dinner so we ate the bar menu which was pretty tasty. It is a little on the pricey side because it is an upscale restaurant but I have a feeling it would be worth it. They also have a gym and yoga room but I didn't partake in either. The location is perfect right in the heart of the Gaslamp district pretty much near everything and there is public transportation right down the block. If you go make sure you visit Extaordinary Desserts a couple blocks away.. Delicious!!! Overall a really cute hotel a bit on the very tiny side. If you don't need much room I would seriously check it out and see what price you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Modern nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S_S2074
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and enjoyed stay. Twin room very small but clean and same amenities as larger rooms. Would have liked to open the windows and not just have a/c. Free internet and very good and friendly service. Breakfast was disappointing (hot meal served cold, bland taste, fruit too ripe). Very good location in downtown, just a few minutes walk to gas light district.

Reviews.Title: “Flabbergasted by the Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: travelangelnow
Reviews.Content: I prepaid for a two night stay. When I arrived early in the morning following my first prepaid night, a front desk clerk told me she wasn't sure she could check me in because I was a "no show". I explained that I paid for two nights and I would be happy to discuss it with the manager. Then, she checked me in. The room had a shower with only half a shower door so the water pooled on the floor during the shower. I learned way too much about the guest next door because the wall was so thin it was like he was in the same room. When I checked out, after staying only one night, the front desk clerk tried to double charge me for the pet fee and the parking fee. The one nice thing I can say about the hotel was the valets are sweet but it felt scary waiting for the car on the street next to the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “a good stay”
Reviews.Author: albertoV05
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small, but they are clean and well equiped except for the pillows that are way too small. The only other thing that can be change to upgrade the comforte would be to be able to open a window for fresh air. The location is very central and we feel safe in the neighborhood. The personnal is very nice. Check-in check-out was easy. The lobby is nice and clean. It is a great touch to be able to use the computer and to print our tickets in the lobby. We really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Suberb Service”
Reviews.Author: ginger71
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed here for 3 nights July 2009. the room is small, but comfortable, tastefully decorated and charming. I would give it a 5 but the bed pillows were small squares and not standard or queen sized pillows. I made a call to the front desk, but I was told that they don't even have regular sized pillows at all. The hotel offers free wireless in the lobby and wired in room service for a fee. The hotel gym is really nice and they also have a yoga room. Make sure to check out the Little Italy Farmers Market on Saturday which is in walking distance. I would stay here again but I would definitely have to bring my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTCPEREZ
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I went to San Diego for a quick get a way weekend. We picked this hotel because of the price, location and type of hotel that it was. We were very pleased with our choice overall. The rooms are very small but very comfortable and had all the amenities that you would expect a boutique hotel to provide. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. This hotel is close to everything and you can easily walk to the Gas Lamp or Horton's Plaza. Otherwise, a bus can get you to Balboa Park area (including the zoo) or down to the water front. Great place to stay especially if you can get a discounted rate!

Reviews.Title: “for me it was like staying in a hotel heaven”
Reviews.Author: willray
Reviews.Content: To me it was the best of all the hotels I have stayed at in San Francisco,Los Angeles,Hawaii and other cities in my life.The staff Natalie,Selma,Autumn and Amanda were the most polite and helpful staff I have ever had.To me there are not enough stars to rate it or them.I was here in San Diego for some medical reasons and these girls assisted me with water, food and ways that are hard to describe in words.

Reviews.Title: “good location great staff pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayc63
Reviews.Content: Well priced pleasant hotel in walking distance of Gaslamp, Horton Plaza and seaport. Rooms nicely decorated and comfy, though airconditioner a bit noisy. Hotel staff friendly and informative. Great bar and bar staff and nice restaurant. Really good value for money. Kayc63

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHANGE OF (HOTEL) PACE”
Reviews.Author: Textraveler52
Reviews.Content: I believe that I have stayed in every major chain name hotel. After numerous trips to California, this was my first visit to San Diego. We found this hotel through Expedia and were willing to give this "boutique" hotel a try. Wonderful beds, lovely rooms, perfectly clean and a front desk staff that went out of their way for us. Great aminities and walking distance to great eateries, bars, entertainment and the ballpark. When we weren't walking, we took advantage of the public transportation close by. YES, the rooms are a bit smaller than you may be accustomed to, but what a GREAT HOTEL and location. If you need the beach, it may not be for you, but if you interest lies in the downtown area, I don't think you can beat it. Speaking for myself, I don't see myself staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown , but I prefer the beach.”
Reviews.Author: ericamegan
Reviews.Content: This May we traveled to San Diego. The first two nights we stayed at the Tower23 Hotel in Pacific beach. We had a great room with a balcony for $269 a night. The third night we moved to the Sofia hotel downtown and payed $249. $28 for parking. This hotel is nice and clean, but the rooms are very small, and the windows didn't even open. The location is within walking distance of the Gaslamp district. The next time I go back to San Diego I will just stay at the first hotel. I felt like $20 a night was way worth having a balcony, larger room, and view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if you can manage with a small room”
Reviews.Author: Panboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sofia Hotel for a week in september 2008 and enjoyed it very much. The room was very clean, and restocked every day - as can be expected by a professional and well trained housekeeping staff. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The location is within walking distance from the action in the Gaslamp Quarter. Price tag is cheaper than a lot of other first class/four star hotels in the area but I believe it reflects the somewhat smallish rooms, as several other reviewers have already mentioned here. We had no problem with that and actually prefer not having to pay precious extra dollars for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “What Hospitality is all about”
Reviews.Author: GreekandSwede
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and genuinely hospitable. Check in/out was very easy. What made this stay great actually started out as a bad situation. After letting the hotel know that the noisy college students were keeping us up, they did everything they could to make our stay better. A manager followed up and compensated us for our trouble. This is a true sign of a great hotel: Although we had a bit of an unpleasant experience, and even though they couldn't predict their guests rowdy behavior, they went out of their way to make sure we left with a good taste in our mouths. Great job Sofia Hotel. We'll pass the word along that you really understand hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Cutre and trendy, but small”
Reviews.Author: guslovesdisco
Reviews.Content: I choose the Sofia because I wanted a hotel in/near the gaslamp district and it was the only one I was able to find for a reasonable price that wasn't a total dump. While the hotel is located right near the gaslamp there are definately some scary-ish homeless/crazies wandering around over there. But then again, they are also all over Chicago where I live as well so that didnt really bother me. Our room was pretty small but we were only really there to sleep so for me it was not a problem. Bed was comfortable, with quality linen and bathroom also very modern as was the rest of the room. Nice amenities in the bathroom as well. Only thing that irked me was that I know I reserved a King room and the bed was a double. The front desk lady insisted that I booked a double bed and that there would be a fee to upgrade to a king. Now, I am a travel agent and booked the room myself so I know for a fact what I booked but after a 4 hour flight didn't feel like arguing with the staff, so I let it go. Also, being a travel agent I got a great industry rate so i didnt think it was my place to complain. As far as value for money goes again I can't be sure since I got a special rate but if I had paid over $200 I may have been pissed about the bed thing. Overall I think Sofia is a great hotel for single travellers or couples especially those looking to take advantage of San Diego's great restraunts and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but rooms are too small!”
Reviews.Author: vegastrvlr80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the local courthouse and detention center. At night I could hear police sirens. The hotel is nice and clean inside, but the room that we stayed in was very small. We had two full/double beds and it would be generous to say there was 3 feet of space to walk in anywhere in the room. Would not likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More Economical than Chain Hotels with Twice the Style.”
Reviews.Author: KenCT
Reviews.Content: I visit San Diego regularly and keep on the lookout for reasonably priced lodging convenient to mass transit. It would be difficult to do better than this. If you're expecting the usual McHotel, however, this is not it. My room was small, bordering on tiny, with a view of an air shaft. But it was well-organized, with features you might expect in a far more expensive hotel, such as premium bedding, flat screen television, refrigerator, and microwave. There's not much room, though. You should try to travel light. Owner Ken Winslow clearly oversees the staff with affection and class. They hospitable, competent, and well-trained. There are free Internet stations in the business center. A free guided walking tour of the Gaslamp District is offered every Saturday and Sunday at 9:00. The guide is both entertaining and informative. Don't miss it. The hotel's location is ideal - downtown and walkable to many of its attractions. Although San Diego's mass transit system is much maligned, it's convenient, inexpensive, and easy to use. For $5.00 a day, visitors can take advantage of unlimited travel on the city's bus and trolley system. Pick up the #992 bus at the airport, and about ten minutes later you're at the door of the Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “The value for the money is not good.!!”
Reviews.Author: cmp22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, but be sure that you can find a better hotel with the same money that you spend there.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stays”
Reviews.Author: smithington
Reviews.Content: I did not have a problem with this hotel; however, I would not like to stay here longer than two nights. The rooms are newly remodeled but they are small. The staff is not very friendly and the restaurant is over priced. My boyfriend and I wound up walking around the hotel to find breakfast and we found a great place a few blocks away for a much reasonable price. Parking is expensive and you do not have the ability to get your car yourself, everything is valet. Stay here only for short visits to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WHC74
Reviews.Content: The Sofia provided a nice stay for my wife and I. The location is great, especially walking thru the Gas Lamp district for restaurants. We loved the design of the hotel. The only concerns are the additional fees for a "view" which was of the street (I guess better than the bus depot) and the thin walls. There is no room service but it was a good price for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: kari l
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had a great stay. The hotel was clean and super conformable. It was within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, the water and the gaslamp quarters. The gym is great, as was the business center. I will be back and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Spend a tiny bit more money and avoid this wanna-be boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: windycityfoodie
Reviews.Content: We used our Citibank Thank You Points to book this hotel for free so despite the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to give it a chance. I looked into how much it would have been to stay if we paid regular price and it was only $25-$40 more per night to stay at one of the hotels right in the Gaslamp. It was our first time to San Diego and we were pleasantly surprised to get door to door from the airport to the Sofia in just about 10 minutes. Unfortunately, as we came up the street we noticed the San Diego Court building a block and a half away, and the city jail one block away. We had a lovely view of two different bail bond locations next door from our room. That coupled with the bus station on the other side of the hotel and all of the people milling around outside made us too uncomfortable to walk anywhere from the hotel. We are from Chicago and used to city life, but this was pretty seedy. The doorman at the hotel was lovely and super helpful, as well as the front desk staff. The front desk man quickly offered us glasses of water and suggestions for the easiest way to get to the bars/restaurants we were going to that evening. The lobby however looked like the entryway to a cheap apartment building. It only got worse when we got to our room, it was TINY! I have stayed at hotels all over the country and this was smaller than rooms in New York City! Immediately when you walk in the sink is on your left and then to your right is a pocket door leading into a room with a toilet shoved against the poorest designed shower ever. The shower looks pretty before you get into it, but it is just a glass wall that partitions off half of the shower and when you shower water sprays out into the floor until it is soaking wet. We laid down towels to soak up some of the mess but I would imagine that people slip and fall all the time in this shower. The rest of the room was filled with way too much furniture, we had to lay out our suitcases on our bed and get out what we needed and then zip them back up since there was no where to do it on the floor or on a stand. Admittedly, I am sensitive about my bedding, but this bedding just wasn't fresh at all. The only redeeming quality were the very nice black out shades (not drapes) that covered the chicken wire covered windows. We didn't sleep well at all though because of our location to the jail there were constantly sirens throughout the night raging past our windows. Overall, I would avoid the Sophia (even at the price we got it for!) and stay somewhere else. The people that work there are wonderful, but they can't make up for the property.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: tenith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 2 night during our 3 week holiday thoughout the USA. The room we were given was tiny and there was no free internet in our rooms. The location was very central but I was shocked by the amount of homeless people in the downtown area. The room price was okay but I probably wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: foodieMnT
Reviews.Content: My GF and I were looking for a extended weekend getaway and decided to take the train from SB to SD. After researching and comparing prices we decided on the Sofia based on the many well written reviews, We just returned from our 4 day getaway to San DIego and have to say that the hotel was above average as far as style and customer service but lacked in other areas. My first impression of the hotel was a little disappointing due in part that we had arrived at 4:30 and the room was not ready, we were asked to leave our luggage and return in 30 minutes. No problem especially since we had requested a specific room which they were accomadating. Once in the deluxe queen room we were amazed at how small the deluxe room really was. Decor was nice, modern and very clean. I agree with other reviews the shower set-up is strange, only half a glass-door present so shower water land on floor, no tub in bathroom. Internet not free in room $10 a day. Location is next to greyhound and bus depot so there are homeless and transients just outside the hotel, albeit harmless. At night ambulance sirens can be heard all to frequently which made it difficult to sleep at times ( we were on the top floor and could still hear everything). Aside from those details you can walk around the downtown area, the mall, 5th avenue and even to ballpark easily. Bus and trolly are user friendly if you dont have a car. Dining at the Currant for lunch or dinner is a MUST, food is excellent and service is top notch. FYI- We decided not to drive largely in part because of the overnight parking fee of $26/day. Amtrak depot is 5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday vacation!”
Reviews.Author: dexterjoon
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late on this review but I just signed up =) We spent 4 days in San Diego for my honey's birthday in December. My fiance's one request was that the hotel be downtown close to the Gaslamp District to walk. I found a great deal on Orbitz for this hotel so we booked it. The reviews on yelp.com freaked me out a little bit but for the price and location I wasn't going to complain. I was pleasantly surprised to find that although the room was small it was laid out well and comfortable for the two of us. Our bed was heavenly! We put a towel on the floor when we took a shower to avoid a huge mess since they only have half doors on the showers. The location was great. We could walk to the Gaslamp and Horton Plaza. There is a nice restaurant onsite and an "express pizza hut" downstairs.... I'm shamed to admit that we ate pizza right before midnight more than once. I read a review where someone complained about the weird SQUARE pillows and how it was so hard to sleep with those. I cracked up when we got to the hotel and saw that the pillow cases were tucked in and the pillows were regular sized pillows that were puffed and tucked to look like squares. All that reviewer had to do was unfold the pillow!!! The lobby is nice. The internet is available at all times. Paying for valet parking was steep but those valet boys are awesome! Overall, the hotel employees were very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Class, style and elegence”
Reviews.Author: carmen88
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed, the hotel sits opposite Horton Plaza and close to the Amtrak train station and San Diego bay - location wise, it could not be more central. ROOMS Yes the rooms are quite small, but they are very well appointed with everything you could possibly need. Very clean and modern. The matress was amazing! I got a perfect night's sleep each night of our stay. There is plenty of wardrobe/cupboard space to hang your clothes and other items. There is a desk with a lamp large enough to do any work that you may need to do. There is also a very comfy arm chair with matching ottoman. There are two lamps either side of the bed which can be dimmed and swivelled around to your required spot. There are two bedside tables. The bathroom is very clean and modern also. The sink sits outside of the bathroom itself. There is also a mini fridge and microwave. You are also supplied with a coffee maker and mugs and glasses. The only thing was there was no cutlery - we ate a few microwaved dinners to save some money so we had to buy some cheap cutlery so that we could eat it. BUSINESS CENTRE There is a well set up business centre in the lobby which has a sliding door which may be shut if necessary. There is a telephone for business calls as well as three computers and one printer. The computers were very reliable, but sometimes there was a bit of a wait because the hotel is primarily a business traveller's hotel. We did not eat at Currant (the hotel's restaurant) because it was quite pricey and a little intimidating. Again, this would suit the business travellers which seem to dominate the hotel's clientele. The staff were very professional. Housekeeping ladies were lovely. The hotel is charming and very cozy. Just sitting in the lobby was nice and relaxing - there is a fireplace and plenty of comfortable chairs. In terms of finding places to purchase groceries and toiletries near by - there is a Ralph's about two blocks behind (south) of Horton Plaza - it had everything you needed including beautiful premade salads and cold meats which made very nice, cheap and easy meals if you are tight on the budget. I would recommend going straight to ralphs as the small grocery store in Horton Plaza ( i think it is a long's pharmacy) doesnt have everything you need. There was also a discount grocery store on or just after 7th street on Broadway - we purchased lots of microwaveable soup bowls from there - made quick and easy snacks or meals - we also found our cheap cutlery and a few plastic containers to store left overs in - this place is great, but be aware that there are a few undesireables that hang out around it - maybe go there during the day. In terms of fast food near by - there are plenty of food outlets in Horton Plaza with a wide range of types of foods - there is also a pizza hut on the same block of the hotel - about 20 metres from the front of the hotel. Again, you are close to the bay - so go down and have some seafood at the many restaurants along the wharf. Also, seaside village is not far (about a 10 minute walk) - this has a few nice restaurants with varying styles and budgets. All in all, the sofia hotel was an excellent choice in san diego. If i went back to san diego, i would stay here again. Make sure you shop around for the best price - we booked through expedia and got it a lot cheaper than the hotel's website was advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in an excellent downtown location”
Reviews.Author: jcollision
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this lovely hotel. The room was small and a bit overstuffed with furniture, but it was very nicely decorated with a modern flair. The linens were plush and the bed was very comfortable. The shower stall was a bit awkward - no curtain. It was nice to look at, but not practical - water inevitably went everywhere. Valet parking (the only option) is very spendy at $28 per night. Next time I will research other options. Upon checkout I detected an error on my bill. This was immediately corrected by a clerk who was very courteous and apologetic. The hotel does appear to cater more towards classy business travelers than leisure visitors. The hotel is an a great location, with many interesting sights, shops and restaurants in the area. We celebrated Mardi Gras in the Gaslamp district - it was a raucous good time! Not for everyone, to be sure - but we found the event to be very colorful, loud and generally safe. In the morning we were able to quickly and easily navigate to the airport. Our only regret is that we didn't have enough time to see more of the city! We will certainly be back, and would very much enjoy another stay at the Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: weichem
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It is close to the bus stop and Gaslamp area. Lots of restaurants to choose from. The room was not very big but comfortable and new. The gym and yoga room were well equiped. Definitely a great place to stay if you don't intend on renting a car. We bought the 4 day bus passes for $15 each and got to most tourist locations with it.

Reviews.Title: “Terriable customer service, staff is lier, be careful in signing your contract”
Reviews.Author: hotelSanJose
Reviews.Content: At the time of check in they told that I am responsible for the incidentals as the room is prepaid by my company. After 4 months they charge my credit card with $600. When I called they told me this was a mistake by the hotel and they have have credit. The credit did not arrive. I called them again and they told the same and assured that manager will call back. Manager never called back. Called again and the same answer. Finally I called found manager one fine day. He told me that the travel agent never paid. I told them if they will cancel trust this travel agent in future and they said yes. Its pain to deal with these people and i have disputed with Amex on this..If you have choice, avoid dealing with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jamison
Reviews.Content: San Diego for being a 'little' city has historically and hysterically high prices for hotel rooms due to its status as a convention/conference destination. After looking at reviews in Trip Advisor and finding an incredible deal ( under a $100 per night) on Expedia, I did not hestitate to book a room. Service at the front desk was top notch. My reservation ( through Expedia) was not found, but I was offered their original rate. The location is superb - close to everything and SAFE. Some reviewers have noted the bus terminal. They must be from Grosse Point or Palm Beach, I wish my own city station and its riders were as neat and tidy. Rooms are not huge, nor are they large - they are standard Manhattan sized rooms or to be exact, circa 1930 rooms. The hotel is a histoircal preservation piece and gives out wonderful handout detailing the hotels history. In essence ,it was the Trump Tower of its day! DESIGN, DESIGN....though the rooms are small, every inch is well thought out and appointed. Very European. Linens, towels, toiletries very plush. Cozy bed and nice reading lamps. Public areas were very comfortable and the internet station a delight. Plusses: The on site restaurant Currant - trendy with a great menu & even better, a terric happy hour from 5 to 7 - fun to watch the locals unwind on Friday night. EXCELLENT free city tour on week ends with a lively and informative guide - highlight of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here.”
Reviews.Author: Suplada2dmax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofia for 9 nights. My room on the 4th floor was overlooking the corners of Front Street and the main road. The room could comfortably accommodate 2 people but since I was travelling alone, the room size was just perfect. I particularly liked the clean linens and bathroom. I appreciate the microwave in the room (american servings were too much for me because i eat like a bird .. but its economical because i can split one standard meal into 2), the concierge who patiently gave me the details going to old town, the business center and the sofia people. loved the location. i can count the number of times i rode a cab -- usually it was because i was running late for my conference which was in another hotel. Almost everything of interest was within walking distance. it's so near the happening place -- gas lamp quarter. it's near a laundromat, the bus stop, the trolley/amtrak stations, seaport village and a few stops away from old town. loved also the 7-11 nearby and the coffee bean and tea leaf downstairs. oh, just a minor thing, one night i was awakened by moaning from the adjacent room. no kidding. good thing there was a radio that helped drown out the noises. i don't know if it's because the couple were just loud or if the walls were at fault. probably the former because prior to this couple, everything was quiet except for the usual doors shutting and stuff. overall i loved the sofia. would consider staying there again in the future. and of course, because people in san diego are soooooo nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: GaylaT23
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the â€œWâ€� Hotel but I wanted to reduce my cost, so one of my friends recommended the Sofia Hotel in San Diego. Although the rooms were not quite as large as the other hotels I have stated in, I found this hotel to be very trendy and warmly decorated. The staff at the Sofia Hotel more than made up for any room size deficiencies by supplying superior customer service in a friendly manner. It was a very pleasant experience that I will be repeating in the future. Yes, excellent service at a reasonable price is alive and well at the Sofia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: ATMCalgary
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in the heart of San Diego. The rooms are quaint, neat and well furnished. The hotel is exceptionally clean, and the staff is fantastic. Just ask any of the friendly front desk folks where to eat, how to get there and they will give you the lo down on all that is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: DinkorSink
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia Corporate Travel My afternoon meeting was canceled so I was able to catch an earlier flight. Called the Hotel at 12pm to cancel and was told their policy was 24 hours in advance. I was charged for the room that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leabharcailin
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at the Sofia Hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. While showing us the way to the Balboa Park bus stop, the employee learned we were going to the zoo and gave us a coupon for admission. The concierge was very helpful in storing our bags and getting a taxi for us. The double non-smoking room we stayed in was a little on the small side, but the location was ideal. Very close to the Gaslamp Quarter and not too far from Seaport Village and the waterfront this hotel was a great deal in a great location. We felt safe at night and walked to/from the places mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ooba
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, Great location a few blocks from the harbor and a few blocks from the gaslamp district. Great bus transportation system. Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Still Pickwick”
Reviews.Author: MCD77
Reviews.Content: This place is the Pickwick with a coat of paint. Don't be fooled. We had a teeny tiny room on the 6th floor (top level thankfully) but could hear the woman sneezing with our door closed in the room across the hall. I could hear the guy next to us reading his newspaper (turning the pages) and a woman REALLY enjoying herself on the other side of us. I had requested a corner room but no dice. This was the oddest hotel room I've ever been in. You walk into the room and immediately on your left is the sink. It is a cute sink but completely oversized for the room. The bathroom door slides out from the wall and would not stay closed. You basically had to keep an eye on it the entire time you were doing your business. Everyone else has commented on the shower so no need to elaborate there. The bed was comfy but the room so crammed with furniture that it felt claustrophobic. There was a chair on the other side of the bed that was pressing up against the wall and the bed - it was completely unneccessary. It just made the room feel smaller. We had a lovely view of the Greyhound parking lot and the gorgeous chicken wire in the window to keep the junkies and drunks of days past from jumping was a classy touch. My computer screen is about the same size as the TV. Unless you paid for a suite I wouldn't bother at all with this place, and if you are staying here remember to pack your white noise machine because you are going to need it. Despite the fact that there is a restaurant downstairs, there is no room service and you can't take their glassware up into your room. It just gives a "lack of cooperation" attitude that is unimpressive at best. I only had some fries and a ten-dollar bottle of sparkling water (that is the only choice I had for sparkling). The BF had a very lousy omlette from what I was told. Since I live here in SD, I knew about the location and had been to Currant before for drinks. I didn't mind the walk down to the Gaslamp and the East Village for entertainment and frankly, I was thankful for the time to have escaped from our chicken coop of a room. There is no way in hell I would have stayed 2 nights unless I knew that I was paying rock bottom prices (from an Expedia sale). If I was on vacation or paying a higher rate I would have checked out early for sure and rebooked elsewhere. The plus side is that it made my apartment feel HUGE by comparison. I was so happy to be home.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shiroubi
Reviews.Content: I was immediately attracted to the boutique charm of this hotel My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a convention and I was really pleased with the service at the front desk and valet (valet is $28/day. Yikes!). valet service was quick and friendly, though I would suggest to park in the underground lot of the business center (Washington Mutual) located straight across the hotel for a cheaper rate.. I booked the room at a third party site for $165/night (peak season) and we stayed for 4 nights. As you may have read already, the Sofia Hotel is a boutique-style hotel, and the rooms tend to be on the smaller size. No problem for us! I loved our room. It was beautifully decorated and had a cozy feel to it. The bed was so plush and comfortable. My ONLY complaint is the shower. There is no door so water spilt out of the shower--despite our best efforts to not make such a huge splash while we showered. Be sure to have plenty of towels available. It's really no big deal; we're very easy-going people and the lack of a shower door was not grounds to despise the hotel--though some people with very discerning tastes may believe otherwise. The location of the hotel is perfect, about ten minutes walking distance from the San Diego Convention Center and about 5 minutes walking distance from the historic Gaslamp Quarter. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very small room”
Reviews.Author: r.butterworth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sofia for 3 nights after a cruise holiday having searched TA for a city centre hotel. The Sofia is ideally located for the convention centre, gaslamp area and city centre business. It is in a beautifully renovated building but unfortunately they have concentrated on making too many bedrooms and consequently it is not suitable for more than single occupancy and then only for a short stay. The hotel bistro is very good and all staff are very helpfull but ...........

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel with brilliant staff!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2travel2often
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel only a few days ago and absolutely loved it. The hotel is in a great location just a few blocks away from horton plaza shopping centre (16 blocks of shopping heaven!) as well as only a few blocks to the centre of the gaslamp quarter-a brilliant place full of bars, restaurants and little boutiquey shops. I was a little dubious about booking the hotel before i went as i had read reviews about tramps/homeless people right outside the door etc but i'm so glad we did book as it was such a good hotel. I'm not going to lie and say that there weren't homeless people around, we did see 3/4 when it got later but they didn't bother or hassle us and i never felt threatened or unsafe walking around the area. Best bits: The receptionist who checked us in was amazing...so helpful with maps and tips on what to do in the city/where to eat/what to see etc. I just feel so ashamed that i can't remember his name. But he was a great help and it set our few days at the hotel on the right foot as he couldn't have done any more for us. The location was spot on, close enough to shops and the gaslamp district without being too in it. the walk was easy (approx 5 mins) to get to both areas as well as a short walk to the mta (approx 3 blocks). we dropped our hire car off near the airport on kettner blvd and got the mta to santa fe depot (which is right on broadway-where the hotel is based) it was so easy to get around and deal with public transport i recommend it. because it was so close to the mta we ended up getting it to the fashion valley district (this great big out of town shopping mall that has loads of shops for all sorts of people) as well as to old town-the original part of san diego, a great tourist spot! i would also recommend "old town trolley tours" their location was just outside abercrombie and fitch in horton plaza (5 min walk from the sofia) a great tour to help you get around and see all of san diego as they stop at the zoo, coronado island, the convention centre, seaport village, the wharf, old town and a few others i can't remember! all in all a great hotel and a great place to visit!! i know we plan to stay there when we go back to san diego

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NottsDinkyDoo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sofia after stopping off at the Carlsbad Premium Outlets on the way down from Anaheim, which if youâ€™re coming that way, has some great designer clothes shops at (from an English personâ€™s point of view!) very cheap prices! Check in was without flaw and the front desk staff were extremely polite, helpful and informative. We were given a room upgrade as the vendor we had booked with had failed to book the room we had paid for, which was very good of the hotel, as this was not their fault â€“ we were also given a breakfast voucher for the mix-up, which again was much appreciated for something that was out of the hotelâ€™s control! Although not the largest room on our trip, it was very modern and very comfortable â€“ we had no problems with the amenities in the room. Wi-fi Internet is complimentary in the lobby, where staff are polite and informative whilst also very friendly. This hotel is in a great location, with easy walking access to the Gaslamp Quarter and the docks, where there is a great little shopping plaza. Yes there is a bus depot near to the hotel but not once during our two nights did we see any untoward characters as suggested in other reviews, and we felt safe, day and night. The bus stop for the zoo is pretty much directly across the street and was cheap access to the zoo - this was a great day out and you must go to the see the pandas! We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel restaurant as we were out pretty much all the time, but it seemed busy with non-guests also walking in. In conclusion, a reasonably priced hotel close to the centre of things â€“ if we couldâ€™ve changed anything about our holiday, weâ€™d have come here for longer and shortened our stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: vegasrick71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed following our honeymoon cruise and the hotel is wonderful. We had a king bed and the room was well appointed with VERY comfortable bedding. The room was well decorated with a LCD TV, and even a microwave / mini fridge. The resturaunt serves a great breakfast, although it is a bit pricey. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. It is close to bus and trolley stops, but we walked to the gaslamp area (few blocks) , the cruis terminal, and Balboa Park without any difficulty. The area does have lots of homeless, but we saw them all over downtown, and had no problems at any time of day or night walking around. I did hear hallway noise throughout the night, my wife didnt. Overall, well worth a stay. Incredible hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “So So disappointed, what a chaos: oh my God !”
Reviews.Author: divinidylle
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop before travelling back . When I organised this 3 weeks California-Nevada roundtrip we thought it would be a nice idea to rest the 4 last nights in San Diego before driving back to L.A. and fly back to Europe. We chose this city hotel on purpose as we like to be central because of the restaurants, shopping etc â€¦ but we definitely expected more for this hotel. I read in a few reviews here that the rooms were very small and decided to book 3 suites as I found a very good deal on Expedia. Having said that I can confirm indeed that the normal rooms are extremely small as I saw them when walking through the hotel. Our Suites were very cosy and the design was ok but thatâ€™s it, here is a summary of our stay Positive: - location if you like to be central in the city and next to the Gaslamp area. - full non smoking hotel - design of the rooms (pleasant) - rooms well cleaned - not far from a big mall - nice bar & restaurant at the hotel (Currant American Brasserie), with nice waiters Negative: - the area very close to the hotel is not very safe (or at least thatâ€™s the feeling I had) as a lot of people begging and strange people as well due to the tram station (internal station) next to the hotel - the air-conditioning & ventilation is very very loud even when completely switched off - the rooms are very small and even the suites are small. All our rooms in L.A., San Francisco and Las Vegas was bigger than the suite, so this gives you an idea how small the suites and rooms are - very small TVs and very minor choice of channels - this hotel is so noisy, we just could not believe it. My brother changed 2x rooms within one hour because of this ventilation noise, it is incredible) I know it is an old building made new recently but they kept the old thin windows. You can hear the police and ambulance sirens as if you were sitting in it (They should offer free Quies ear plugs as they do in some hotels is San Francisco). Because of this we were so tired in the morning and were happy to leave the room as you can imagine - if you arrive on a Sunday afternoon, you better be patient, because the only alternative they offer you in case of a problem is â€˜We can change your roomâ€™ - very bad internet connections and no WIFI in the rooms but like in the 80â€™s with wire only .When I arrived in my room, I could not access it and called the reception and of course as it was a Sunday evening they could just offer to move rooms and try it again or wait for the day after when an IT person is there). I called again and they answered that it was because I had a MAC, so they gave me a printout with explanation how to change setting in my computer in order to access the internet. After a few hours, I gave up â€¦) the day after I tried again and the line was so low, so slow, it was terrible. I travel a lot around the world but never experience this. Normally as soon as you are in a room (MAC or PC) it should connect straight away but not here and they ask USD 10,- a night for this service, sorry this is not normal !! They offered me to use the free lobby Wifi internet but as I had to use my laptop for confidential material (work), this was not possible. In this case, sorry but internet in the room should be free of charge! - the laptop cable is so short that I had troubles to look at the screen the way I wanted - if you take a suite, there is only a phone in the sitting area and not next to the bed (what is the logic of this??) so that it the telephone rings anytime and you are in bed, you have to run to the phone - cleaning is sometimes done very late in the afternoon (5-6 PM) I have learned one thing about this stay: if travelling to the U.S. from Europe I would recommend to book hotels though www.expedia.com instead of any of their European websites because if you have a problem like we did when trying the change hotel, due to the time difference it was unfeasible as they need to contact the U.S. Expedia first, etc â€¦. And it is cheaper !!! it is often the same price between the European and U.S. website. This is definitely not a business hotel and also not a pleasant hotel if you like to sleep at night. People that are sensitive to noisy (sirens, ventilation, next door room doors) DO NOT STAY HERE and recommend to take an hotel at Coronado (superb beach) or La Jolla (as second choice), it is 10-15 minutes drive if you want to come for dinner in town. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. STAY AWAY OF THIS HOTEL, especially for long term stay !!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but cramped”
Reviews.Author: paulrb48
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay prior to joining Cruise Ship. Hotel is well located on Broadway close to Horton PLaza in one direction and Seaport Village in another. Area is plagued with homeless but they are in the most harmless. Hotel is moden and clean, but public areas are tiny. The reception area, lobby (if there is one) and public areas are very small and not made for anything other than transiting through. The room was unbelievably small. I was led to believe that the double room, with 2 double beds could accomodate a family of 4. Wrong - the is literally no space whatsoever in the room. On arrival we couldn't find anywhere to put our bags, let alone unpack any of them. We had to drop the bags on the floor around the bed space, and climb over them to get onto the beds, and stay there or leave the room. Just about bearable for one night, but no amount of minor gimmicks (ipod connections etc) can make up for the basic lack of space. Wouldn't have been able to stand more than one night. Staff very courteous and helpful. Didn't use other facilities so can't comment

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice, but not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: profgold
Reviews.Content: On first look, it is quite atttractive. Nice look, friendly and helpful staff and free business center Internet computers. But there are so many problems that I just can't recommend it - even to my worst enemy! First, the rooms are VERY small. The average hotel room is 350 to 550 sq. ft. This hotel's queen rooms are only 207 sq. ft. so everything is tight. For example, their towels are longer than either the length or width of the bathroom. The bed is comfortable and the toiletries are very nice, but most everything else doesn't make it. The lighting is limited, you can't go to the bathroom at night without waking your spouse because of the fan noise, there is no shower door (probably because there is no room in the bathroom to open a door) or even a regular bathroom door. After the third time that the air conditioning noise and blast of air directly on the bed woke me, I tried to find a place in the room to escape its effect, but couldn't. I finally went down to the somewhat spacious lobby for the rest of the night to escape this claustrophic room. (Maintenance came twice to try to fix the A/C, but it was still very uncomfortable). They took an older building and did a valient effort to make it into a boutique hotel - but, ultimately, they failed. The very small room size plus some implementation failures make this a place that I just can't recommend even if the price was attractive. (It reminds me of the closeness of being in an MRI machine). We went to the coffee shop just outside the hotel and it was very nice and a good value. We did not walk around the neighborhood, so can't react to the reports of it being a marginal area. There were a large group of us staying here, and discussions with six others indicated that they have the same negative view of their stay. After two nights of this, I ended up moving to a hotel on Shelter Island (near the airport) for the night before my flight and, while it was not as modern as the Sofia, was much more comfortable and a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great base.”
Reviews.Author: janeandpaul_8
Reviews.Content: Lovely, well designed hotel in a good location in down-town San Diego in the gaslamp quarter. Staff were professional and helpful. Rooms were cosy but really well furnished and designed. It was everything we wanted for our stay in San Diego and was a good base for travelling around the city with easy access to the trolley and bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as promised”
Reviews.Author: jamaine1066
Reviews.Content: This looked a nice 'heritage' hotel at first, but we found that the room (which was very good for watching the vagrants on the street corner) quite small and a bit poky. The restaurant was not good and very expensive, lucky there was a good coffee shop next door. Eating out was okay (when we were not being pestered by the tramps) but there sure are some weird people in San Diego! Check-in staff were very good, but two nights was enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: becca1637
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old daughter and I had never been to California so we searched online and booked part of our trip in L.A. and part in San Diego. We absolutely loved the Sofia Hotel. The boutique rooms are very pretty, yes we had a crappy view but who cares you arent in your room for the view, we loved the modern makeup of the room, yes your bathroom floor gets wet when you shower but put the bath mat down to catch it. I cant complain about anything at this hotel. They have a business center with 3 computers for your use with a printer and they were very quick to provide maps and directions and recommendations for places to eat. Its a few blocks away from the Gaslamp Quarters and PetCo Park which was quaint. If you want a great breakfast go to Richard Walker's Pancake House or the St. Tropez Cafe. We didn't rent a car. We used the public transportation system which got us to the zoo and seaworld with no problems. I would definitely stay at the Sofia again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travelers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: MplsBoys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for business travelers - this is a very old school hotel room style - the rooms are extremely small (the bathroom even smaller) - the closet doors can't even open all the way - I feel like I'm in a shoebox. The restaurant is prominently displayed on the website and even at check-in after a long flight I asked "is room service available" (they said yes) - when I called down to the restaurant to ask for room service, they informed me that there was in fact no room service, but I could come down and get to-go. Ended up eating dinner out of a cardboard box complete with plastic silverware Blech. Seriously, no room service for a hotel charging these rates per night in a downtown location?? Despite a high price, they also still charge another $10 for wired internet service in the rooms. Ridiculous. Small window looks directly into another room. Might be well placed for leisure travelers, but I definately won't be staying again when travelling to San Diego on business.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dotcom
Reviews.Content: Initially we were impressed however after a 14 hour flight and asking for a quiet room we were put in a room next to the lift and overlooking the air con units and busy Greyhound terminal, went back to reception and were moved. Rooms are tiny but beds v-comfy. House keeping is awful, rooms not made up until 5pm, even after leaving the room at 8am and putting the 'make up room' tag on door. Complained once, next day same thing, this time assured it wouldn't happen again and that the house keepers had been talked to, then next day happened again, at this point spoke to the manager who was less than interested and said he had no control over house keeping... For the deals available at the moment go else where if you want a stress free stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed The Sofia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supersergio
Reviews.Content: I spent five days in San Diego and I stayed at The Sofia Hotel. I loved the place. I selected the hotel after reading the other reviews, and I tottaly agree with those who gave a favorable opinion about the hotel. It has a great location (in Broadway, very close to Gaslamp Quarter), the rooms are quite nice, the staff is always helpfull and the beds are awesome (I was told that the beds are custom made; they are built in China specially for the hotel ) The truth is that even if I wanted, I couldn't say a single negative thing about the hotel. I will definitively choose The Sofia Hotel for my next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatisthis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. Downtown San Diego is on your door step. The Gaslamp Quarter is only a few blocks away which offers a very lively night life for all tastes and ages. The sea front is also a short walk away. Good bus links to all the places you'd want to visit such as San Diego Zoo, La Jolla, Old Town etc. Horton Plaza shopping mall is 5 minute walk away and provides excellent shopping. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and the staff were very polite. Our room was a little cramped but that didn't really matter as we didn't spend much there. You may require a bigger room if you were to spend longer there or for exampe if you needed to put down a travel cot. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Boutique Hotel in a Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: Seaforth35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia during a 2 night visit to San Diego and loved it! - The reception staff were friendly and helpful (allowing us to check-in early and giving us a top floor corner room with great views. ) - The room was well decorated and a decent size (if a bit smaller than the average US hotel room). - The location of the hotel was ideal for a city break, just a couple of blocks from the all the bars and restaurants in the GasLamp. We stayed in 5 hotels during our trip to CA and this was our favourite â€“ If you like boutique hotels youâ€™ll love the Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mel_H_8
Reviews.Content: We checked prices online and then called the hotel directly. They matched the lowest online price and gave us a free room upgrade to a king because the queen wasn't actually available for all the nights of our stay. We brought our 50 lb. dog. There were a couple of extra fees to be aware of. Parking is valet only and $28/day. The valets were quick and friendly. There is a public garage for $15 a day about a block and a half to the southeast. There is also a $50 pet fee (per stay, not per night). The hotel staff were all friendly and smiled when they saw our dog. The room was very clean and comfortable with lots of extra pillows and towels. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The extra towels were necessary because the stand-up shower has a glass retaining wall for half its length and no door, so it splashes out quite a bit. The hotel was pretty quiet and we only heard our neighbors when they were opening and closing their closet. The halls are all pointed out from the building, so many rooms have windows facing rooms in the next hallway. We were disappointed at this set-up at first, but they put us the room closest to the elevator and stairs, which was ideal for taking the dog out to do her business. About a block south is a lawn to the federal building that even has a poop-bag dispenser (although it was empty during our visit). The hotel is next to a mall that is dog-friendly and a short drive from Balboa Park, where there is an off-leash fenced park. The restaurant in the hotel was pretty pricey ($15-20 for breakfast before beverages), but looked nice. There is also a Coffee Bean attached and an organic caterer that serves breakfast M-F across the street. Overall, the Sofia was a very comfortable and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “small room and stupid staff”
Reviews.Author: pambeasley
Reviews.Content: at first glance the sofia hotel was seemingly ok, but once inside it proved to be a different story. i found the rooms to be extremely tiny and far too crowded for 2 people to share a queen size room. i also found the staff to be entirely unhelpful. One night after a late dinner, our key was not working to the room. For some reason we were forced to wait over an hour, while the hotel staff tried to decipher this situation. Overall, I'd say the hotel was ok, but I wish I'd stayed somewhere that hired people who had achieved something higher than an 8th grade diploma.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy boutique for cool people”
Reviews.Author: JCFElp
Reviews.Content: We were initially apprehensive about staying in a hotel with "small" rooms (as other reviewers mentioned), but we loved it! The hotel had history and charm and was still trendy and upscale. We got a good deal on Expedia for 4th of July weekend and went with the queensized room. The room was small but no space was wasted and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Our room was next to the elevator but there was no noise at all. We loved the staff, the service and the onsite bar/restaurant. If you are looking for a typical big chain hotel then this is not for you. If you are looking for something a little different, a little more hip, and you can handle a small space with awesome linens and decor, go for it! We enjoyed our stay immensely and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique is Unique at The Sofia”
Reviews.Author: happycoupleGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Sofia. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible room service/cleaning. It was so lovely to stay at a small boutique hotel in an original building built in the 1940's. ideally located in the Gaslamp Quarter and yes is located right next to bus station but no noise or distrurbance experienced. There were a few vagrants hanging around but they did not bother us at all.
